text:
The food here is fresh and the coffee is delicately prepared. Thank god for Ilys Italian roast! Oliver is a very respectful host and super friendly. Every time I come here the service is friendly but a bit on the slow side since lunch is pretty busy.

Definitely try their eggplant and ANYTHING with pesto, it's delicious and the proportions are perfect for lunch! The seafood bisque is rich and creamy. If your feeling sweet try their monkey latte.

My only peeve is that this place is a little awkward to get to and it's tucked away on the side of a freeway and corporate offices.

Wow, baguette cafe is definitely a new favorite spot in vegas! Wish we had known about it much sooner. First, Olivier is such a sweet man and is so warm and welcoming. The place is small, clean, and cute. The food is GREAT! Thank you fellow yelpers. 

We had the vegetable quiche with salad, cup of carrot soup, eggplant/prosciutto sandwich, and apple carrot juice. Everything was wonderful! You can tell everything is homemade, fresh, and made with quality ingredients. We hope to see this place continue to thrive, because we will be back anytime we are in vegas!
oliver and his mother are very pleasant, offering fresh delicious breakfast and latte ... supporting local & thankful for my friend for introducing me to this fabulous cafe!

So the food was fine (although a "prosciutto salad" should have actual prosciutto crudo on it, not the cheaper ham-like cotto, in my book), and the service was excellent, but if you, like me, read the article about choosing the best restaurants in the U.S. based on Yelp reviews, you're going to be disappointed. Especially if you spend $60 on a cab to and from the Strip. I'm sure it's a lovely spot for the people working in this office park, but if you're not one of them, you don't need to go way out of your way to eat here.

Love this place.  The family who runs it owned their own restuarants in the south of France.  Everything is handmade, daily, with a lot of love.  Everything I have had here is over-the-top delicious.  The prices are great and so is the coffee.

This is an update review coz Yelp won't let me review twice ..my last review couple years ago was a A ++ and today this just became triple +  becoz they now open on Sunday's ..our perfect hangout for lunch after church :) ..always great food and Ã¼ber friendly and personal service from Olivier and mom ! Love love this place !!!

the ILLY COFFEE n the ALL pastries and especially the QUICHE vegetable and Loraine off the hook GOOD 
been there 2 weeks in a row DELISH !

Sweet little spot for good food and 95% of the time great service.  Only once we got subpar service from the overwhelmed make server/bus boy.  But, we have gotten SO MUCH amazing, lovely service from all the ladies BEFORE that, we can get over that one. Keep up the awesomeness!

You can tell that the owner Olivier cares about what he's doing. Not only was the food super, his fresh, home baked croissants great, but giving a great customer service and talking to his customer also means a lot to him - so all in all, a fantastic place to go for breakfast (which was what I tried).

The best french bakery in Las Vegas, all around. Their pastry is very flaky, a real delight,  from the croissant to the quiche, everything is a must try! 
Pain au raisin (raisin filled pastry), pain au chocolat, torsade au chocolat, just to name a few. 
And their sandwich are to drool for, the French baguette is very crispy and light, their omelette made with fresh eggs and you can have it runny inside with all sorts of ingredients, jam, double cheese, bacon, mushrooms, onions... this bakery has nothing to envy compared to any bakery in Paris, that left alone, to any french bakery in vegas. 
5 thumbs up!
The food is delicious here! Great prices & friendly service. The seating is limited, and it is kind of hard to find behind business park, but well worth it. I am a fan!

I can see why this place gets great reviews. From the moment I arrived I was treated as a friend by the staff. When the server found out it was my first trip to the Cafe they gave me a quick run down on the menu and the daily specials. They were very helpful. I had the turkey baguette, side salad, iced tea. They all were very fresh and tasted great. The prices  were very reasonable. The service was quick. This is definitely going to be a regular stop for lunch. I can't wait to try some of the other items on the menu.

I've come here on several occasion for breakfast and lunch. I've had almost everything on their menu as well as their iced and hot coffees. Everything is delicious and reasonably priced. Tthe owner is also very friendly. Indoor and outdoor seating is also available.
My money was really well spent. I just wish there are more restaurants like this. This place is a real gem for Southwest LV.

Really good breakfast/lunch place. The coffee is good but not great, however the food shines. Their croissants are as good as can be found. The tuna salad with egg is my personal favorite both or a baguette or the croissant.
Best place ever!!! Everything was delicious!!! Oliver is an awesome friendly guy!! We'll be back when we visit from Hawai'i

I'll make it short and sweet. Three "S", Soup, Sandwich and Service was amazing!
Olivier always gives attention to customers.

Prosciutto salad was seriously out of this world. Staff was so friendly and inviting. First time here and now I'm in love. They really care about making connections with their customers and the food is stellar. 6/5

I love the fresh and flavorful sandwiches at Baguette Cafe!  My favorite is the eggplant panini with mozzarella and tomato pesto...such a delicious combination of flavors and textures with the melted cheese!  I recommend sitting in the restaurant if you can find a seat.  The sandwiches are served with a small salad and a delicious balsamic vinaigrette if you eat in.  The chicken sandwich with cheddar cheese, bacon and tomato pesto is also very good, as is the chipotle chicken sandwich.  The only one I haven't liked so far is the Bleu Brie.  I will be back to try some of their homemade soups.  

Definitely order a coffee and relax a while.  The service is great, Oliver is always very welcoming.  It gets crazy around lunch time, though.  The hours are M-F 7a-5p, and they are closed on weekends.  I always want to go for lunch on Sunday, and have to remind myself that it is closed!

I've been coming to Baguette Cafe for almost a year now and I'm finally getting around to writing a review.  I've never had a bad meal here and the service is always fantastic.  Oliver is the best!  You can tell he's very passionate about the food and it shows.  Each of the soups which are handmade daily are fantastic and his sandwich creations are nothing short of delicious.  I wish nothing but the best for this restaurant and I'll be making my weekly/bi-monthly visits for a long time to come.

Been here many times. Hasn't failed me yet. Baguette Cafe has the best croissant I've ever had, and I'm big on croissants. Crisp and flaky on the outside, light, warm and buttery on the inside. I spoke with a French dude. He vouches it's legit. Every time I come, I always have the chipotle grilled sandwich with chicken. Delish. The owner himself works the cash register. He is consistently nice, professional and welcoming. Visit enough times and he remembers your name. Business for him is finally thriving, and he deserves it. Quality food with quality service.

We have coffee and order lunch from Baguette Cafe everyday!! Food is always fresh and delicious. The owner Olivier is very sweet and always willing to go the extra mile for his cutomers! I would recommend any of the daily fresh soups..Croissants or fresh juices! Love this place!

Great and affordable brunch 

The pesto. Flavorful but could be more pronounced. 

The blue brie.  Great proportion of cheese mushrooms and bread with the hint of apple than refresh the melting feeling. 

Egg baguette is very basic,  matching its price 

Bread is above average but nothing great 

Great find

I entered the cafÃ©; it was completely empty, the lights were dim, the smell of exotic spices filled the air.  I thought I was alone when all of a sudden a dashing young European man appeared the doorway.  We exchanged words, emotions ran high, his sandwich making skills were strong but sensual - just like his love making (I would imagine).  I had a panini just to watch him press it...if you know what I mean.

Seriously though, the Moroccan sandwich and the Pesto Chicken sandwich are awesome.  The staff is really friendly, and they seem to have a genuine interest in getting to know their customers.  If you're tired of boring sandwiches, try The Baguette CafÃ©.

WOW WOW WOW!!! Just went to Baguette Cafe twice this week and I don't even live near there. Olivier was so proud of his all house made menu and he should be. I had a special of brie and blue cheese with chicken apple and walnut panini. yummm mmmm...The place was slammed with professionals from the nearby offices for lunch. But, Olivier still remembered my name on the way out-try to find that anywhere else! So I took the family back for coffee and pastries-my weakness. I have experienced many unbelievable pastries while traveling through Europe and all the five star chefs on the Strip....BUT the pain au chocolat was out of this world and just out of the oven.. Heaven!! I love to support independently owned businesses but this is a bonus with amazing food, service and a little jen a se quoi??? Special! Can't wait to go back

Now this is a gem, and worth the little trek off the Strip.  Tired of all the noise and the lights and looking for a little French island of great food (sandwiches, salads and soups) and coffee?  This is the place to go !  Olivier, the owner is so very friendly, explains everything to you and seems to be genuinely happy to run his place.  So inspiring !

It's a little bit hard to find, but some nice yelper made a map you should consider when you want to find this gem (under photos).  The food is mostly sandwiches, soups and salads, but made to French perfection.  Be sure to check out the special sandwiches (for example curry and a Moroccan sandwich were on the menu today) as well as their daily soup.  Get a sandwich with a side salad or a sandwich and a soup.  To round it off, get an Illy espresso and a pain au chocolate.  I cried it was so good...

Had a fantastic vegan vegetable soup for my lunch with my 2 beautiful children on Thursday 
It was so good I ordered another big bowl to go
I've been eating lunch at Baguettecafe for years now it's hidden away just off the 215
Between buffalo and durango 
It's well worth finding , the owners parents are the secret ingredients, mum makes the delicious pastries and dad makes the amazing soups all with organic produce 
Try it you will be hooked also 
Oh did I mention freshly squeezed juices 
And gourmet coffee .
Visit one of vegas's best kept culinary secrets you will be glad you did

I stopped by there one early morning to try one of their hot drinks! Nice people. I go to a nearby building for work related things and they are always talking about this place. When I finally tried it, I was impressed! can't wait to try other goodies t
We move office building but I still swing by here every now and then. Home made pies and goodies awaits you everyday!
Excellent food, great service, and super cheap !! I'll definitely stop by again on my next trip.
First time trying it today! I got the chicken chipotle! Very very delicious! Highly recommend .

It took me a few minutes of circling in the business park to find this place in the back, but not an unreasonable amount. The staff was friendly and brought out food our in a timely manner. My friend and I were the last ones there until closing and they never made any attempt to hurry us out  or make it seem like we were inconveniencing them in any way. Oliver even came over to chat for a bit and refilled my friend's ice tea before we headed out. I had the turkey sandwich and the green juice, both were yummy and I'll be back in the future to try more food!

Stopped here twice so far when I happen to be on this side of town on a weekday (not open weekends). Love the simple menu with a variety of French inspired options. The smell of fresh-baked items when you walk in makes your mouth water! 

One visit I had the ham croissant breakfast sandwich which melted in my mouth - so good. The other time I had a quiche and it was cooked light and season well. Also had the fruit tart which is the best I've tasted in town! Perfect crust, fresh fruit and not too sweet. 

Would live to see this place in a different setting, like a neighborhood spot with plants and a fountain :)
I leave just next door, I love to go for a coffee, breakfast, lunch. It's a great place, the food is simple and really good. The peach smoothie is the best ;)

I like this place. The owner was really attentive to the customers and you can tell the food is made with quality ingredients. 

My bestfriend and I came in for breakfast. She had a croissant with scrambled egg and mushrooms. I had a pesto baguette. I didn't want meat or eggplant so the owner suggested mushrooms. I thought that was really thoughtful of him to be okay with the substitution. We also had the chocolate tart.

We found everything to be good and tasty. We did, however, find the chocolate tart a bit too tasty (but that wasn't bad or anything; just we couldn't eat it all in one go). 

Price wise... It wasn't cheap but also not overly expensive. I thought it was priced pretty decently. Our total with tax was around $19 dollars. We were both full, after.

Delicious!  The croissants are extremely light and fluffy. Loved the peach tart and cheesecake. We went back to the counter multiple times to try more of the menu on this visit! Loved the fresh baked baguettes too.

I keep coming back here! The food just gets better and better. If you do decide to come often, you too will start to notice - the soups, sandwiches, even desserts are Not made the same way each time! That is a good thing! There are variations on ingredients that keep the palate alive and guessing. Today I had 2 things which are superb. One of them is not even on the menu yet. SO, I hope you too can get it - Pesto Vegetarian Spinach Wrap with pesto, cilantro, tomato, spinach, goat cheese and mushrooms and it was grilled! Plus the wrap was pesto too.... Simply delicious :)  For dessert, I had Chocolate Pudding Tart. It was sweeter, yummier than ever before. Olivier's mum told me, it had more cream than chocolate and that she was adjusting the recipe. Kiki and I ate it in under a minute! Mouthwatering, mind-boggling goodness. We also ate the Prosciutto Salad - my bill came to a whopping $13 dollars! Then Olivier gave us 2 breakfast pastries to take home. I shook his hand, and told him sadly that I would not be seeing him till Monday.
It is getting busier here.
There are tables outside. Both in front, and on the side. The side tables sit in the sun. One of the very few outdoor cafes in Vegas. It will be a good year for Baguette Cafe is my prediction.

This place is a great hidden sandwich shop. The staff is really friendly and the food is great. The owner remembered my name on my second visit a week after my first which was fairly impressive. They hand make all their pastries and you can tell because they are great and definitely fresh. If you dont get there early they are usually out of most of them though which does suck. 

I usually get the prosciutto sandwich and a lemon tart. Its a great combination! The quiche they make in the morning is soooo good but they are usually out of it by the time I get there. The soups and salads I have had there were nothing special, so I personally wouldn't recommend them which is why no 5th star. 

The coffees are pretty good as well.

Be warned that they are in a business park so if you go during peak lunch time they are usually really busy and you may find yourself without a seat  and in a long line. But this place is a must try for anybody looking for a private sandwich shop.

Small joint, super friendly staff, good sandwiches, large beverages

Average prices:  tea (mighty leaf) & sandwich was $11/person

Located in an office park, not that easy to find

Great place if you work nearby, wouldn't necessarily trek out to it if not

Tables outside and inside

Music playing inside

No wifi that I could find

Filthy and gross! I do not recommend this place. It's quite filthy, the microwave had fingerprints all over as if it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. The fridge where the bottled drinks and pastries are is completely dirty from top to bottom. I don't think it's ever been cleaned,  you can see all the dirt and lint that is stuck to the vent on the bottom. The cheese sandwich was disgusting. It tasted sour. The chocolate and strawberry tart was also quite weird tasting. I feel this place should have the health department called on them. Also the girl with the crazy unmanaged curly hair at the register was kind of rude. Didnt greet me, and felt like she didn't want to be there. Said probably said 2 words to me.

Yum! Exceptional service and amazing French food. My friends rave about this place, and now I know why! I had the Bacon Quiche with a salad. My friend had the Bleu Brie grilled sandwich with Chicken. We shared the Chocolate tart and the Salted Mango Tart. So. Good. 

The generous serving of Quiche was creamy and savory and melt-in-your-mouth. Bacon in every delicious bite! The crust was outstanding. The salad provided just the right contrast of crisp and crunchy, and the house dressing dressed the salad without taking over.

The Salted Mango Tart - wow! I'm not a big mango fan, so I was skeptical. But the flaky crust, light banana-flavored pastry cream topped with glazed, salted mango was the perfect balance of sweet and tart. Not too heavy, either.

The Chocolate Tart - To. Die. For. Rich, creamy, and chocolatey goodness in a flaky almond crust! Again, not too sweet, but oh so decadent!

I'll be back!

I love everything on the menu. Staff is so nice and cheerful, even when they're under immense stress because they're very busy. They have one of the best, if not the best, lattes I have ever had. I don't have a single complaint because even when they are understaffed and crazy busy and I'm waiting almost an hour to order and get my food, I know that it's 100% worth it.

I absolutely love this place. This has become my favorite place to grab a sandwich and soup. First off, my favorite sandwiches are the Blue Brie and Chiptole! They are delicious. I recommend both. The soups are amazing. I'm pretty sure their homemade. I've tried all their creamy soups and have loved them all. The breakfast panini is good too when it's too early for lunch. Their iced tea is organic and I always stick with the green tea. They have illy coffee and illy raw sugar. The only downside is it's kinda small so when it's crowded it can be hard to find a table and it's definitely becoming too cold to sit outside. Sometimes it can take a bit to get your food during the lunch hour because the surrounding office people come in and it gets crowded fast but it's nothing that doesn't keep me from coming back. The owner, Olivier, is very nice and knows a lot of the customers' names. Mine included. You won't be disappointed! :)

Baguette Cafe is an awesome casual cafe. The owner, Olivier is very friendly and fun to talk to. I go there whenever I am on that side of town. I call it my "treat". Their soups are simply wonderful as are their Panninis.

From the moment I walked in I immediately felt at home. The staff is so friendly and takes the time to get to know you. Oliver(the owner) showed us around explained any questions we had and took our order. I love seeing the owner of his own business!! He is a wonderful gentleman that is very down to earth. The cafÃ¨ is so cute and enjoyable. I got the mango smoothie and it was very delicious.

This is a hidden germ - wonderful latte and the food is perfect. Oliver takes care of his customers and make each visit an experience. Visit LV once a year and this place is always on my to do list. Worth the drive from the strip.

Everything was delicious! Chocolate croissant, pesto chicken sandwich, roasted veggie quiche, croissant sandwich, raisin croissant, yogurt parfait & latte. A fantastic breakfast to end to our Vegas trip. Kid-approved too.

Wow, what a great cafe. The man at the register (I believe the owner) was so hospitable and nice. I can't remember the last time I was treated with such personable service. He was fantastic and really made us feel like family who had dined there a million times before. And the food is absolutely top notch. Fresh baked baguettes and quality ingredients. The grilled pesto sand which with eggplant was ridiculously good. I almost ordered another. The prices are very reasonable as well. I appreciated the service and the amazing food and well definitely be returning!
Fabulous strawberry/choc chip muffins - so very fresh; wonderfully refreshing iced mocha (skinny and poison free); Best friendly staff ever.  Great way to start the day !
Excellent customer  service. The Chipotle chicken sandwich and chocolate tarte is phenomenal . The homemade food is absolutely amazing. An excellent place to grab coffee and teas. Delicious drinks.
The food is great ! The workers here are so friendly.. I go here on a daily basis just to enjoy my day :]

So after reading all these reviews I decided to try it out. Ordered Chipotle grilled chicken sandwich,to go. I guess thats where I made the mistake! So for $8.59 I got a 6 inch tough to chew grilled sandwich which had no flavor at all. Like none!
So disappointed. Wasn't worth the money or my time. Seemed like a good place to sit and eat though! 
Not a place where you order food to go ,for sure!
Too bad I didnt take a picture of that sandwich in a paperbag. Didnt look tempting at all, to even think of taking a picture, contrary to all the other pictures seen here.

I've died and gone to heaven. Seriously. I also have just gotten home and taken my first bite and felt compelled to let people know what they are missing out on. 

I've always bypassed this place before because it's tucked away and hard to get to and is only open during the week during business hours so I never had the opportunity. But now that I'm on a schedule that can accommodate theirs and seeing all the rave reviews I was compelled to come here in my pajamas in search of breakfast. 

I was greeted immediately upon entering and apparently by the look on my face Olivier asked if I had been there before. I told him I was a first-timer and he proceeded to offer me recommendations on their most popular items and informed me of their baking style (from scratch and throughout the day). I went with their popular omelet on a croissant (fresh out of the oven) with bacon. He also asked me if I would like anything to drink; I ended up getting a decaf americano (yea for illi coffee). My mouth started drooling at the sight, smell, and introduction to their cranberry croissant and chocolate croissant (also fresh out of the oven). I caved once my omelet croissant and coffee were ready and asked for one of each to go as well. 

The establishment itself is small but cute. Indoor and outdoor seating as well as a small loveseat with a table. Norah jones was playing on the overhead (bonus points). Next time I'm definitely dining in. 

On to the food - freakin awesome deliciousness. Words do not do them justice. The food tastes as good as it smells. The croissants are the real deal. Light and fluffy and to the demise of my waistline. I might just say it. The omelet croissant was perfect. I can't even describe it well enough to do it justice. How does an omelet croissant melt in your mouth?? Just try it. The chocolate croissant was decadent. Again light and fluffy croissant with chocolate embedded in it's fluffy goodness. Pairs well with coffee. The cranberry croissant had a high bar to meet, I think I was already on sensory overload by the time I got to it, so I may have to try it on a clean palette to give it a fair shake. 

I'm already hooked. Time to introduce my husband to this little slice of heaven. I already can't wait!!

Went there for lunch, greeted by owner who tried to learn everyone's names that came in.  Ordered white onion soup and chipotle chicken sandwich, cheap and amazing, even had leftovers to bring home for later. Highly recommend. Unfortunately not open on the weekends.
Tucked away, but well worth the find. The food was OUTSTANDING  & Olivier & his staff were GREAT... I love this place!

WOW! Where should I begin?! Well, my boyfriend and I are from San Diego and came to Vegas for auctions (like storage wars) well we had a unit close by Baguette Cafe and yelped this place. We liked the reviews it had and all the hype it had about how good the food is so we decided to give this place a try. When we got there, we were treated very nicely by the employers and the place had a very good vibe, we looked at the menu and had very good choices. I got the chipotle sandwich and my bf got I don't know... I forgot but it was a chicken sandwich anyway, I got a vanilla latte and a banana chocolate chip muffin (yeah we love to try everything that's presented to us especially the dessert case) we sat outside and within I say 10 mins or so we got our food, it looked very delicious and couldn't wait to try it. OMG! It was beyond what I have expected! So delicious and full of flavors, I couldn't believe how good a sandwich was until coming here along with the vanilla latte and some unique soda I never heard of, great quality of food here. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who comes to Vegas or locals. There was this guy who was very approachable to customers and always had a smile on his face, I'm thinking it's the owner so it's always good to see great customer service coming from a person who owns the place. Love Baguette Cafe!

Amazing food! Light but filling. Olivier, the owner, is personable and introduces himself to customers as they arrive. 
Definitely a hidden gem. Will be returning often. I need to work my way through the amazing menu.
This cafe really is amazing and I would recommend anyone in the area check it out. They have great breakfast sandwiches and one of the best lattes I've ever had

Awesome place that supports vendors that do non-gmo products.  The owner studied nutrition and offers The Gerson juice (apple & carrot), which is a popular protocol that is intended to fight cancer.  

He greeted us warmly when we entered and as he gracefully multi-tasked, he explained to us their daily quiches and the ingredients in them, told us about options they could create for us.  

A sense of humor and charming...I think I have to come back tomorrow!  A thousand stars!!
Thought the food was fresh and excellent, portions are a lil small, one of the best cheesecake I've ever ate

I was really wanting some illy coffee so I looked on yelp and found this little gem. I saw it wasn't too far from my house and decided to try it. I had a vanilla latte that was perfect! I also tried a chocolate croissant and another type of twisty croissant pastry that had cranberries and cream. They were both very delicious. I will definitely be back.

This place was great! The people who work here were very friendly. They explained the most popular items on the menu. I had a croissant with an omelet inside. It was wonderful. I will definitely be visiting again. Also, it was an inexpensive meal.

Never expected to find such an amazingly delicious spot like this, off the beaten path, about 15 minutes east of McCarren Airport. 
The people that work here are genuinely upbeat, friendly and really seem to enjoy working here. They had such great camaraderie with each other and their customers which I don't see very often.
Great Salad and Sandwich choices, including Vegan options!
The Cream of Zucchini and Lemon soup was out of this world! And the sandwiches were killer too ;)
All in all, this place is  5 stars all the way and if you're driving to Las Vegas from Los Angeles, it's worth taking the time to stop and have lunch here before you get to Vegas, the Strip and all of the over-priced, restaurants for lunch.
Trust me, you'll be happy you did.

Wonderful bakery. Was visiting Las Vegas and headed to Red Rock Canyon. Along the way - just off the freeway - we chose this bakery/cafe due to the reviews and it did not disappoint. Excellent & fresh breakfast croissants, custom smoothies, fresh squeezed OJ and expertly prepared Illy coffee and cappuccino.  The baked goods are made on-site.  The staff was very friendly - especially Anne who took the time to review the menu with us.  I have a lot of speciality French and Italian bakeries where I live and it was great to find one that matches that quality in Las Vegas. Great outdoor seating with music.  I will be back for sure when visiting Las Vegas again.

Great food, friendly service, nice outdoor seating area. What more can you want?

A little out of the way and hidden in a professional plaza, but well worth it whenever I am nearby.

Eh. It's an out of the way, hidden cafe with patrons from the corporate offices that surround it. If I worked in the offices around baguette cafe, I'd probably go back since there's nothing within walking distance around it. But I definitely won't make a trip there for lunch or breakfast. The food was decent, but nothing memorable.
Absolutely a must try! 15 min drive from the strip but it's worth it! The food is so tasty and service is amazing! C'est magnifique! Wish we knew about this place at the beginning of our trip.
Best sandwich place in Las Vegas hands down. Their ingredients are fresh and always delicious. I just wish they were open on Saturdays also!

Came here for the first time because a friend that posted on Facebook said they were really good and I had to come by and try for myself! Everything smelled and looked so good when I first walked in. I ordered a veggie quiche and breakfast croissant. Both were great! Olivier, the owner was great to talk to and very pleasant. We spoke briefly about each other's businesses and I highly recommend for people to come and try anything in the menu. I will be for sure coming back for breakfast and lunch since it's near my wellness center. 

The location is around corporate/business offices and is tucked away but is a gem once you find it! I can't wait to try more from the menu! :)

This was my fourth time visiting this place. I loved it here. Food was great as well as the service. Today I stood in line (me being the only person in line) and had no one help or take my order. The two workers literally stood there and ignored me. It took one of the workers 10-15 mins to make eye contact with me and he didn't even take my order! Or even have the decency to tell me someone will come to take my order. Worst of all he was not dressed professionally at all! Green hat and green clothes? I've never given a bad review before and hate to do so. I just got off a 12 hour shift from the hospital. All I wanted was something to eat. I guess I won't come here anymore.

I live in California and was in town visiting family.  This place sparked my interest being the only joint in Las Vegas on Yelp's Top 100 List.  I had to visit!  We arrived at 2pm on a Friday (because I hear lunch is crazy busy) and there were still quite few people dining inside and outside the cafe.  It is true-The owner Olivier takes his time to explain menu items if you have any questions.  I could feel that he loves being there.

We had the special of the day: The pork loin sandwich - tender slices of pork with a creamy sweet sauce, mushrooms, shaved parmesan, baby spinach and tomato on an extremely well made baguette (crispy crunchy exterior texture, soft interior).  Absolutely delectable.  The chocolate tart and pear tart were very delicious as well.  I'd like to come back to sample the quiche (they ran out) and the rest of the menu :-D.

Seriously it was so good that it prompted me to write a review (not that they need it).  This place is just phenomenal!  Merci beaucoup Olivier and staff!

Amazing!!! Oliver treated every customer like they were his best friend. It was our first time, and there was a line out the door, still he was unbelievable patient, and answered all of our questions with a smile. He obviously shows his food the same love. It was delicious! The decadent chocolate tart even had an almond flour crust. What a rare find in the land of fast food. We also had the sinfully delicious grilled Brie sandwich, with mushrooms. It was crisp, buttery, chewy perfection. I almost hate to write this review, in fear that i will create a longer line and not be able to get in on my lunch hour. :)

I am a fan of the pressed panini. To me, it's a bit pricy for an every day lunch spot but the portions are good and salad is great. Also amazing illy coffee.   They also have an outside seating.  The owner is very personable and staff are really friendly so it make it even more enjoyable lunch time.

Note: Get there early if you do not want to wait on the long line! It's worth the wait but if you have limited time to grab a bite get there early or order by phone before heading over.

After seeing all the reviews and finally being on this side of town in the morning before work, I knew I had to try this place. And Boy am I glad I did! I was there fairly early (7 am!) and they only had a few select options. 

I got the croissant with egg and spinach, a cranberry twist, and a mocha frapp. Just the smell itself was so enticing, I was wanting him to hurry up and give me my food! The place just smells amazing! The food was just amazing and great size. 

The next time I'm able to go I'm definitely going to try their sandwiches and soups. 

I just wish they were open later in the evening and on weekends, I would definitely go here if they had Sunday Brunch. Mmmmmm~!

Authentic French patisserie with delicious bread, coffee, croissants, sandwiches, and pastries. The owners are very friendly and always happy to practice speaking French, even if yours is as bad as mine. Highly recommended

A great sandwich begins with great bread, and the freshly baked baguettes are fantastic!  I finished my lunch with a cappuccino and a chocolate croissant.  If that's not a 5-star lunch, I don't know what is.

There's no question that this is one of the best places for cappuccino in the entire city. 

As I mentioned in my "Las Vegas Critics" review, "Olivier is the friendliest, most welcoming business owner that I've ever encountered in Las Vegas."

As soon as you walk in you are greeted with the most amazing smells. You practically want to eat the aroma that surrounds you. They make fresh everything everyday. There has not been an item on the menu that disappoints. Our absolute favorite is their quiche. The flavors are incredible! I strongly recommend this place!!!

Food is always good. You have to watch people at the register. The lady who took my order overcharged me a whopping extra 50 cents. Hardly worth squabbling for in my mind. I can only imagine what was going on this lady's head.

The greatest sandwich I have ever had my entire life. The owner is super nice and every person that works there treats you like a human being and not just a sale. Chris was so nice when he gave me my food and checked on me and asked how my food was. I plan on trying everything on the menu. The pesto sandwich was amazing. Chris recommended to chipotle next. I Know Where I'm GOING tomorrow!
Love this place! The deserts are amazing, coffee so tasty and the soups are delish! Great atmosphere a little hidden jem. I highly recommend this place for breakfast and lunch.
Love this place !! The food and coffee here are so nice. This cafe is full of nice and passionate people. Can't wait till we come again next time.
OMG this place is amazing. The pastries are to die for. Breakfast Egg Baguette is so so good. Fabulous coffee. The mugs are huge. Absolutely will come here again and again.
SUPER SLOW!  9 minutes waiting after placing my order and still no coffee.  15 minutes until my quiche arrived.  I stopped in here to quickly grab a bite to eat.  Good thing the quiche was delicious.

This place is one of those hidden treasures I stumbled upon. The best quiche I have ever tasted and I have a lot to compare with. You can tell the owner has a passion for food. Great dishes, amazing service, and over all great atmosphere for lunch dates.
Fantastic service and food. Look forward to coming back. French onion soup was incredible!

CANNOT WAIT TO COME BACK! The cashier/owner is so nice! The mango smoothie is soo good! I also got the chicken pesto sandwich....OUT OF THIS WORLD GOOD! I'm going to be a regular here! Really nice and kind of chic! Can't wait to try everything! EVERYTHING sounds soooooooooo good!!!!!

We found this place on yelp and decided to come and try it out. I had the chipotle panini and quiche..it was awesome. My 3 year old son eat my other half of the sandwich all by himself. He loved it so much. The quiche was good as well it was moist and flakey. The price was very reasonable!! I like the owner, he's very nice and friendly. Definitely coming back again.
Love this place. Amazing soups, sandwiches & service. Always enjoy the banter with Olivier.
Had a roast beef sandwich that was off the menu and just fantastic...filled out and will not be hungry for a while

This place is amazing. The owner is welcoming and full of suggestions. I love that. The watermelon lemonade was the best. I suggest coming at an off time (before or after lunch) because it can get quite crowded. Worth the wait!
I am a regular at Olivier's place for a reason. The most personable guy in the business. Great healthy and creative options.

To quote Oliver Twist, please sir, may I have some more?  All I can really say about this place is wow.  The food here was as good if not better than a lot of the food I had while I was in France recently.  Breakfast here yesterday was a treat, especially as Oliver was pulling fresh bread out of the oven while I was standing there.  I had the pain au chocolate, and it was superb to say the least.  The chocolate inside was spread evenly throughout, and it was sweet but not too sweet.  The pastry was what you dream pastry should be like, light, fluffy, flaky and full of flavorful.  Every bite was a mouthful of deliciousness.  I also tried their quiche Lorraine, which was wonderful as well.  It was not heavy nor dense, and the flavors all came through wonderfully.

I am so happy that I discovered this place near my new place, and I know that this place is now my go to breakfast spot.

And a note for all you soon to be first-timers, it's located in the back of the office complex if you enter of Sunset Rd, so don't be worried that you don't see it straight away, just go around the buildings and you'll see it tucked away in the back.  It might be easier if you're coming from east of there to come in off Raphael Riviera, as there's a driveway entrance located right next to the cafe.

I love this place! I go there once or twice a week to do some work and always love it. It's location is a little bit confined to the business complex that surrounds it, but I'd pretty much go out of my way to come here no matter where it was located.

Olivier is a great guy and very friendly which makes my visits very pleasant. I've had several of their sandwiches and loved them all. Same for the breakfasts. I wish they had more pastries because every one that i've had I thoroughly enjoyed. Fresh and moist phyllo dough, just out of the oven tort... sorry, i was daydreaming..

In all seriousness, this is one of my most precious finds in Vegas and one that I will continue to go to as long as I can!

One of the few affordable places in Las Vegas that actually deserves top marks. Another high review is superfluous at this point, as Baguette Cafe has taken on a life of its own against some pretty hefty odds. It takes truly exceptional food and a passionate chef to survive in a half-dead commercial block on the outskirts of suburban hell; that's the only endorsement B.C. really needs.

This is the best French cafe I have ever tried !  It is a little bit far from the strip but Must go place !  We had sandwichs, soups and a fruit tart. Everything are sooooo delicious  I will  come back for sure

Today was the Croissant and egg with a latte.
Quite tasty and filling. I plan to try every menu item because everything has been that good. In other words, I will be back at every chance. 
Staff and service were great, a local business I enjoy supporting. Fresh food prepared fresh!

Awesome spot for soup, sandwiches and pastries. I've been there several times, and each time the food and the service have been spot on. The owner is so personable. He remembers his customers and takes the time to get to know new ones. Love the dressing that comes on their house salad (also on their prociutto salad). It's amazing and I always ask for a side to dip my sandwich into. I've tried the portobello sandwich, the chicken curry sandwich and the chipotle chicken. ALL WERE OUTSTANDING. Recently, they had a shrimp bisque which was very tasty as well. PLEASE OPEN UP ON THE WEEKENDS!!!

It is my new  favorite place. The service and quality was excellent. And they go out of their way to make vegan options and are happy to make their customers happy! IThe panini, soup, and green juice was amazing. t was the best lunch I have had in this town.

Can't get over how nice the owner is. He sold me some illy espresso even though he doesn't carry the merchandise anymore but yea he made it happen anyway. Plus they make their own pastries I'm gonna have to go back to try some
Great place to eat the food is absolutely delicious...
Food was fresh and homemade. My original review was unfair. They are doing good things here.
I found this place on yelp. Since it has a good rating, I decided to check it out. Staffs are very friendly and the food is great. Def worth checking out.

A friend recommended this place and was she right! It's a very nice French cafe that offers healthy selections. Had Moroccan sandwich and it tasted not great but decent. They will bring your order to you and offer pretty good service and are fairly efficient.

This place is amazing...like everyone else, the host Olivier is awesome. He welcomes you with hospitality and continues until you leave. I think he makes an effort to remember your face and name.. he immediately asked me if it was my first time and called others by their first name.
The place was a bit hard to find (Google maps was not accurrate). If you find yourself staring at a business building, just drive around to the back and you'll see it. 
They use Illy, so that was a plus for me to come here, but learning that all their items are "fresh" made and he is making a goal towards all organic and fresh (not frozen).

The food was very good! Olivier accommodated  my request for regular pesto instead of the walnut pesto that was an ingredient in my sandwich. The atmosphere was very nice and the staff was very friendly. I will stop in again to try their espresso.

Service:  Friendly staff and courteous service.  

Food:  We ordered hot sandwiches - Curry Chicken and Chicken Pesto, which are not on the regular menu but recommended by the staff .  Both are tasty and well balanced flavor.  The sandwich  plate came with a small side salad which I think the portion can be little more than just two small bites. 

Interior Ambiance:   Small, Semi-modern, Clean, Bright. 

Overall:   We enjoyed the food. A good first time experience here. We will certainly come back.

Solid 4.5 since giving a 5 is for above and beyond.

Pros:

- Everything on the food menu has been great!  Had The Moroccan Sandwich this time.  Judgment call on the price to food portion, but the dishes are on the healthy side.

- Nice selection of beverage though I have only tried a normal latte.

- Great service for a small operation; they bring your entree to your table!

Cons:

- Customer Service...they are just too busy especially during lunch hours to clean the tables fast enough...not necessarily a bad thing.

- Customer Service...they are just too busy especially during lunch hours so there can be a long line...not necessarily a bad thing...nom nom food takes time.

- More shade for outdoor area...probably a complex matter though.

Star(s):

- Olivier

RATING: A +

SERVICE: A +

AMBIANCE: B -

OVERVIEW: Arrived to the cafe around lunch time. Not the best idea. Very very limited seating, you'd be lucky to walk in a find a seat with the lads. When the owner is in the cafe, you will receive outstanding service. The sandwiches are absolutely amazing. Wether you're ordering a breakfast or lunch sandwich you will not be disappointed. I ordered a egg and spinach as well as a chipotle chicken sandwich.The food is definitely the best part about this cafe, the coffee is just "OK." I ordered a cappuccino, and it was definitely nothing to die for. Always look forward to stopping into this cafe when I am around.

My husband and I have heard excellent things about this place and we finally got to try it this morning. It was FABULOUS and DELICIOUS!!! I personally felt like I might as well have been eating in France. Anyway, we had the croissant and egg sandwhich (one with turkey and one with ham), espresso and cafÃ© mocha. All were the best we've ever tasted. This is not your typical cafÃ©. You can taste the high quality, freshness, and wonderful flavor in each bite. Service was also excellent, and the owner was warm and welcoming. He took the time to give us a "tour" of the menu. We definitely are excited to go back and try more food from the menu. My husband and I highly, highly recommend!!!

One thing I miss most about the Bay Area is all the amazing places to eat.  Seldom do you find small family owned businesses like that in Vegas. Last time I visited Sonoma County my Father brought me to his favorite cafe which happened to be hidden inside a business complex.  I remember wishing we had places like that in Vegas.  Well, my wish came true.  I kept hearing about Baguette Cafe and my girlfriend and I finally decided to stop by and try it out.  Little hard to find at first as it is tucked away in a business complex but so glad we tried it!  It was everything I had hoped for with even better customer service.  The staff were all so warm and welcoming and the food was simply amazing.  They also have the best iced white mocha I've ever had.  My new favorite spot.  This is where I'll bring all my friends when they come in town.  What's so funny is I just got here, one of the first people in and I greeted them saying I'm so excited (to eat here).  The very next person to arrive just said the same thing haha... I guess I'm not the only one.

I always pass this place while driving on the 215 and wondered if it was any good. I always assumed it would be some typical cafe with subpar food and generic coffee, considering it's location in a cluster of business buidlings. And boy, i was wrong! I was in the area today so i decided to try it out. When we got there, there was a line literally going out the door. We waited about 15 minutes so i would suggest avoiding going there during lunch hour. When we got to the register, we were helped by a guy who was really friendly and informative about their menu. He remembered our names and seemed to genuinely care for his customers. 

I got the turkey sandwich and an iced white mocha and my friend ordered the curry chicken sandwich and a funky monkey specialty drink. We were so hungry and being that they were so busy, we knew it would take some time to get to our order so we grabbed a goji bar to munch on. The bar was made from all naural products so i expected it to taste like cardboard but it ended up being SO GOOD! Our sandwiches were also delicious, especially the baguette that they were on. 

While waiting for our food, we kept eyeing the peach tart that was in the display case. We ended up giving in and buying a slice and im sooo glad we did! It was probably my favorite part of the meal. It wasnt too sweet and the crust was the best i've tasted in a while! 

This place is awesome and i would definitely recommend eating there!
Please!! A little cafe with a French chef!! This place is amazing!! Fresh breads and pastries, plus their homemade soups are insane! Everything is fresh. It's delicious.

Great food but service is sooooo slow!! I come here about 5 times a month because the food is great. But please be warned that if you don't have a long lunch break or are in a hurry this is def not the place for you. 1 cashier no matter how busy they are. Wait time is always about 15-20 min minimum even on slow days. I even tried calling In my order 3 different times and gave them about 20 min each time before I even got here. And guess what?? It still took 15 min. Never fails.

My favorite place in the entire world.
There is NOTHING on the menu that isn't incredible; I'm not kidding you.
My personal favorite is the Chicken Curry Panini.  When I'm watching my carb intake (cough), I'm a huge fan of the Prosciutto Salad.
All of the pastries are baked in-house each morning by the owners, and I simply cannot resist a banana or strawberry muffin if they're available.  
The quiche Lorraine is my favorite of the quiches, but Olivier usually switches up the type of quiche prepared every few days; keeps things interesting, you know?
The cherry on top of this entire deal is the fact that only Illy coffee and espresso is served.
The owner, Olivier, and his entire staff and family are the sweetest, most personable people on the planet.   Even if the food wasn't orgasmic, I'd come back just for the service.

Baguette Cafe is one of my favorite family owned restaurants. It reminds me of a cafe in France as the smell of the fresh baked flaky croissants, chocolate  twists, muffins  and many other fresh baked items greet you as you enter.  For breakfast I enjoy the omelet croissant  with their special tomato basil sauce--and as always, served with a side of greens topped with their homemade dressing.  Sometimes it gets busy but being warmly greeted by Olivier and his mom is well worth the wait!

It was my first time visiting Baguette Cafe today. It is a little bit hard to find as you can see the sign from the 215 going west,so you have to actually exit durango and make a right on sunset. It is located at the end of some office buildings. You can also access it from the frontage road and make a right. The owner,Olivier is very charming and will recommend you what to have if you are unsure. I had a Cafe Mocha which was served in a big porcelain cup and was very delicious. They serve Illy cafe which is an excellent espresso. I took Olivier's suggestion and ordered the chicken curry sandwich.I asked for it to be a little bit spicy. I was not disappointed at all as the sandwich turned out to be one of the best chicken currys i've had. I would recommend you sit outside if the weather permits. 

Overall great experience,great staff,excellent food and drink selection!

Too much hype.  I was so excited to come here as it's not open on the weekend and it's rare that I am free during the weekdays during lunch hours.  I wanted to try their soup but the soups were not available yet and they offered to sell me yesterday's soup.  Yeah, you heard me right yesterday's soup.  I politely declined but in my mind I said to myself *&^@#$!  That sounds gross.  If I am paying good money for something, I don't want yesterday's scraps.   Anyways, I got the chicken pesto sandwich and my hubby got the blue brie with chicken sandwich.  My sandwich was terrible.  The flavors didn't match and I couldn't even finish it.  Highly disappointed and their Chai Tea was nothing special (it was kinda watery, or maybe I'm just used to Sambalatte).  

However, I'm giving this place 3 stars because my hubby's sandwich was very good.  The flavors were well balanced and it just works.  Would I come back here again?  Probably not.

Love this place! The staff is always extremely friendly and welcoming. The chicken bacon chipotle sandwich is absolutely amazing! I also love the chocolate tart! They have amazing food and coffee drinks. My boyfriend and I visit this place very regularly. HIGHLY RECCOMMEND! :)
By far my favorite brunch place in town!!!!! There is nothing else to say!!! Just come and try it out, will never disappoint you!!!!

This is by far the best brunch place we've ever been to Vegas...
breakfast omelet and morocan sandwich just awesome....
Definitely going to be back.....^^

I had to try it after seeing all the great reviews on yelp. Oliver was incredibly nice and the food was fresh out of the oven.

I only had a blueberry muffin and and a vanilla frap but both were excellent.

Baguette Cafe is a lovely place to frequent.  I am pleased to have found a great French cafe in Vegas-definitely reminds me of Europe.  The food and coffee do not disappoint, and the owners are charming and friendly.  Do check this cafe out.  I highly recommend it.  And Olivier is awesome!

First time here, traveling through from San Francisco.

My first impression is - this place smells great! 

We ordered:
- Breakfast croissant sandwich (egg, spinach, etc), added turkey and it came with small salad
- Organic parfait (came with granola and strawberries)
- Eggplant sandwich, also came with small salad
- Another croissant (my 2 year old toddler can't get enough of the croissant from the croissant sandwich, so we had to order extra one)
- Chocolate tart (amazingly delicious)

Everything was good, will definitely come back here.

First time here and I must say we were pleasantly surprised. Oliver was extremely nice and seemed so appreciative that we came to support his business. The food was delicious, best quiche I've ever had, everything tasted so fresh. The crossiants, muffins, twist,  fresh juices,  espressos..everything tasted just wonderful. Will definetly be back again.
The food and hospitality here are some of the best in the city of Las Vegas. Please stop in and enjoy why Olivier and his staff create on a daily basis. Thank you Baguette.
Went there and ordered a salad, only to find a bug. Please remember to wash your fruits and vegetables.

The quiche lorraine was excellent.  I don't like quiche, but tried my husband's to keep an open mind.  And it was delicious.  The eggs were very fluffy almost like they were whipped.  Also, the owner (Olivier)  was very welcoming and friendly.  We will definitely go back.  C'etait super !

I FINALLY got to try this restaurant on Memorial Day because they are not open on the weekends.  Olivier was so cheerful and so helpful from the moment we walked in the door!  And Olivier said they are about to start opening for brunch on the weekends this summer!  YAY!  

We had two coffees, a ham & swiss on a croissant, an eggplant sandwich on a baguette, and a roasted veggie quiche.  I do NOT say this lightly, but this was one of the all around best breakfasts I've ever had at a restaurant.

So excited to go back!!!!!!!

Looking for something other than your usual corporate coffee/breakfast joint, my boyfriend and I came here and we are so glad we did! We were cheerily greeted by the owner, Olivier, who took the time to ask our names and chat while we ordered. Super nice guy. I ordered the croissant and egg sandwich with added mushrooms. It was light and flaky with wonderful flavor. My boyfriend got the baguette breakfast panini which was good, but he liked my sandwich better. We even took a croissant with Swiss to go because it was that good. The portions are just right  and not huge (might seem small of you're used to a typical American breakfast). Prices were incredibly reasonable and food seemed to be of high quality- not a combination you see often! Despite being busy the service was excellent. My only regret is that we did not try the quiche. Wanted to but we were in a hurry and they were still in the oven. It is not too often I come across such a delightful combination of kind people doing good things with food for a good price. He even uses organic whenever he can and supports local businesses. Can't recommend highly enough. Thank you Olivier!
Tried this place for the first time and IM HOOKED!! I loooove the Moroccan sandwich! The staff is also very friendly and informative. They know their products and their menu suggestions are dead on.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! I am allergic to gluten and diary, and any sort of French restaurants are usually impossible for me to eat at, but not here! They actually cared about me and my allergies and worked with me until they found something I could eat. I ended up ordering a tuna sandwich on a gluten free wrap and a vanilla soy latte. If I lived in LV I would be here every day for brunch if I could, it was that good. It deserves five stars, no question.

While visiting in Las Vegas, friends and I stopped by for lunch last week.  The Baguette Cafe is terrific!  I had a moist quiche with flaky crust, alongside the most fulfilling carrot soup I have ever eaten.  We shared an assortment of great, fresh salads.  And, since it was the end of the week we celebrated with a slice of both the pear tart and the chocolate tart.  They were better than what you would hope to get at most high-end restaurants.  Did not mind it being in a business park.  It was relaxing to sit and talk, seated on the outside covered terrace.  It's great to have good, healthy, fresh-made choices for lunch!
Hey I am new to the area and I just wanted to show my appreciation to the companies in my new town. This cafÃ© was sooo good. I will definitely be back...

The best in Vegas. I come here a few times a week for lunch, my office is close to the restaurant. The chipotle sandwich is my favorite. They also have Illy  coffee which is delicious. This is a family owned business and they will treat you like family, the food is phenomenal and the service is even better. We are lucky to have a restaurant such as this one in Las Vegas.
This place never disappoints.  It is always a pleasure to interact with the owner.  He is very passionate with everything he offers.  Great price, great food, great atmosphere.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE. After my friend introduced this cafe to me last year, I have been coming back so often that the owner Olivier pretty much knows my name. After I had a taste of their baguette sandwich, I have become a sandwich snob and no other sandwich in the city even compares. How much do I love this place? After moving to the other side of town earlier this year, each month I still drive 11 miles ONE WAY to this place for my favorite chicken curry baguette and cup of soup. It's crazy, but it's definitely worth it. 

The menu has breakfast sandwiches, wraps, salads, sandwiches, coffee, drinks, and French pastries. There are 2 soups of the day, and they vary each day depending on what Olivier wants to make. I love his cream of potato soup with truffle oil and butternut squash soup, but I've never been disappointed by any of his other soups. The first time you come here, Olivier will be more than happy to explain to you the items on his menu, and he's always enthusiastic with customers. He wants you to love the food as much as he does. The food is made with love, and I think that's why I like it so much. I would definitely recommend the chicken curry sandwich (it's not on the menu though) and the chicken pesto sandwich is delicious as well.

The cafe is located in the same plaza as a whole bunch of big business buildings so it can be a bit confusing trying to find this place the first time. The cafe is small, with about 5 or 6 small tables on the inside, but there are more tables located outside. I've noticed many of the customers are people who work at the nearby office buildings on their lunch breaks, but there are also many customers who, like me, make the drive for the food and relaxing atmosphere. The cost is a few dollars higher than your regular sandwich, but it's well worth it for fresh baked bread and ingredients. 

The only gripe I have (and I've told Olivier this before) is that the cafe is only open until 5:00 pm Monday-Fridays. It makes sense as most of the office buildings nearby operate on the weekdays, but I get mad cravings for my chicken curry baguette and soup on the weekends!
First time here. Loved my breakfast croissant with egg, Swiss, Carmelites onion, spinach and mushrooms. Really cute place that smells great!  Will come back!

There is a new leader in the restaurant landscape of Vegas. Olivier and his crew know food to a level you would expect of a Michelin rated establishment. Take note gluten allergy suffers. Phenomenal customer service and the affordability is in a word - awesome.

As some yelpers know this place is slightly harder to locate in a office park - but it's a great location and both the indoor/outdoor layout is relaxing.

Everything is good. In France chefs can be measured by the quality and consistency of their food. The sandwiches are very well done - the soups are fantastic.


You are gonna want to try everything - enjoy

If I could give Baguette Cafe 4.5 stars I would -- only because I want to them to be open weekends!

This is truly one of the gems in Las Vegas. I try to make it in here one or twice a month. Oliver and the staff are amazingly warm and familial. And the food is fantastic. It's clear there is a great deal of care taken into the creation of each dish. The balance of ingredients is spot on. Oh, and the bread... oh my god, the bread. I keep meaning to ask if they sell it. It's perfection. 

I lived in France for 3 months when I was in college, and this is truly the only place I've been to since that really reminds me of the food and atmosphere there.

Have had the worst luck having items removed from the listed item. 
The place is so good, but for me the constant errors has forced me to take my business elsewhere  and I'm so sad about that.

I'm in LOVE! 

Today was my first visit to the Baguette Cafe, and it was perfection! I had the sublime Cream of Zucchini Soup which has to be one of THE BEST soups I've ever had! Next I had the Prosciutto and Salami sandwich on a croissant which I ate v-e-r-y slowly because it tasted so good I didn't want it to end...LOL. And to finish everything, I had the decadent melt-in-your-mouth Chocolate Tart for dessert. Did I mention the absolutely wonderful people behind the counter?? 

I'm excited for my next visit!
Really great sandwiches with good ingredients and good bread.  Also some great pastries.

This has become my local spot! Love everything on the menu here and I especially appreciate the giant coffees. 

Favorite sandwich - the Eggplant Sandwich YUM 
Breakfast - The Quiche is amazing

Wonderfully delicious Veggie Quiche. So fluffy and flavorful. Then a chocolate twist as a breakfast dessert washed down with a sparkling water. Breakfast of champions.
Can wait to come back and try lunch.

This place is family owned and the french owner is a very nice guy. I haven't had a ton of variety here but I love the Chicken Pesto. The bread is baked fresh daily and I'm a sucker for any fresh bread. They buy their vegetables fresh from the farmer's market and also have a variety of different soups made fresh daily.

The size of the sandwich is about a 6 inch sub from subway and is about $7. They have desserts as well but I've never tried it before. 

8/10 Good to go.

This place was excellent! Food was fantastic, Oliver is so welcoming! He really cares about this place and does a great job of showing it. Before even ordering I knew it was going to be a nice experience.

The food was delicious, fresh, and presented quite nicely. I had a chicken sandwich and some pastries that just melted away with every bite. Definitely go check this place out it's a little buried treasure in this city.

My only gripe is that Baguette Cafe is not on my side of town!

Great food, great people in an odd location.  A little hard to find the first time, but well worth it.  

Breakfast or lunch, the food is just excellent.  Great and unique flavors, the food is made with passion.  And just like a good BBQ restaurant, once they run out for the day, they run out.  That's how it should be with something like a quiche.  You make it in your morning batches, keep the quality up and when it's gone it's gone.  Nothing sitting in a fridge or a freezer for days.  Hats off.  I wish Vegas had more quality family owned places like this!
Food was delicious, coffee was great and the staff was quick and very courteous. What more can you ask for? The place was also super clean. This was a great find. Highly recommended!

Great experience every time. Great service, amazing food, by far my favorite cafe in Las Vegas. 

My favorites include the tuna salad sandwich, quiche, chocolate tarts, salads- all amazing!

Delicious! The owner, Olivier, took our order. He was very friendly and welcoming. 

We munched on the egg panini on a baguette (yum!), the veggie quiche and the mixed berry torte. All were exceptional! The coffee was great too!

Will definitely be returning!
Wow this place is always so good. Love sitting out in the patio with the music... What a nice little break in the day and the food is always amazing!!!

Run, don't walk to this place.  Talk about great food mixed with excellent customer service!  Olivier and his team do a phenomenal job!  The food is ridiculously good and the price is right on point.  Wife and I ate on sight (croissant breakfast sandwiches), and took some quiche for the road.  Yelpers got this one right.  Well worth the 15 minute drive from the strip.
Best place to have breakfast in Las Vegas. Fresh, tasty and super service. Look no further.

Breakfast or Lunch, you decide! Why not both? The constant hustle - bustle of this small cafÃ© is a clear reflection of their phenomenal foods. Baked fresh several times a day - the traditional croissants, soups, quiches, and other delightful pastries are just a few of their signature items. Olivier and his family know how to earn respect and keep repeat business. If you haven't yet mage it here, you ARE definitely missing out.

Love this place. They owner is very personable and remembers everyone's faces. They bake throughout the day so it's always fresh. Mostly all organic ingredients. Always different soups but always consistent throughout the board. I've never left here unsatisfied. Once a week we have the croissant with egg and spinach. The texture is perfect and crispy, I'm drooling thinking about it. 
It is pretty small in there but they also have outdoor seating. My only issue is how busy it gets. Sometimes I feel like I'm waiting forever. Most of the time I'll call in advance for a pick up order and I still have to wait a couple minutes. But definitely worth the wait.

I'm always looking for a non chain cafe that doesn't feel like i'm in Vegas and this is it. The man who owns it is super friendly and his staff is equally as nice and helpful. The paninis my husband and I had to be some of the best. We will be returning!

Definitely recommend checking this place out! Think of a small coffee shop but with amazing food with great flavors. Their coffee's and drinks are good though too! The service has always been awesome and its the perfect little spot for a light breakfast/lunch. But I would avoid the lunch time rush cause it definitely can get pretty busy with all the businesses around the cafe. Highly recommend getting their croissant's!

This place is the closest place from my house which serves ILLY coffee so I decided to stop by.  The coffee is great as expected and the sandwich I got was delicious!

The owner(?) was very friendly.  Maybe too friendly. Haha.  He literally didn't stop talking the whole time me and my friend was there.  But overall great service.

They should at least put a small sign on the entrance to the building because it took like 5 minutes to find the place, even though it's easy to locate from 215.

A nice little spot located in a corporate center just off the freeway. I'll start off by saying the service was excellent. Everyone was very delightful and attentive. I had the pleasure of experiencing the roasted veggie quiche and the eggplant sandwich and must say both were very flavorful. The roasted veggie quiche was not dry and contained a nice crispy crust. The eggplant sandwich also contained a nice toasted baguette with a soft delicious center. The coffee here was delicious as well. I don't regularly drink coffee black but I definitely enjoyed their black coffee. Definitely a great place for breakfast or lunch. The atmosphere is delightful as well playing nice tunes while you enjoy your meal.
The quiche is fantastic!  We needed a respite after a long day of travel and The Baguette hit the spot.  Perfect!  Olivier provides excellent customer service!
Love paninis and cappuccino with almond milk! So helpful and friendly! A must try!

This establishment is a sublime vacation for the senses. From the subtle wafting aroma of fresh bread , To the beautiful display case featuring hand crafted pastries and  delicate morsels of pure bliss. The service was kind and professional, and I was reminded of  the well mannered nature of people from the south of France. Please, I encourage all foodies and those that desire a formidable dose of opulent cuisine at a very reasonable cost. Visit this cafe, you shall NOT be disappointed.

We saw this place being the only restaurant in Vegas on Yelp's top 100 for 2015 and had to try it. Honestly we were underwhelmed. You can taste all the fresh ingredients right off the bat but the flavor wasn't there. I like the salad came with the sandwich but the sandwich itself is really bland. I can see this being a good choice for people live/work close by. But it's not worth the drive. Sorry.

I love Baguette Cafe. It's one of my favorite cafes in Las Vegas. 

Olivier and staff are kind and friendly people. 

The eggplant + prosciutto is my favorite sandwich to get. The three cheese + prosciutto is my 2nd fave. Their drip coffee is good and the large is definitely a large - a good caffeine boost to start your day. 

There's indoor and outdoor seating. I love the outdoor area with umbrellas. It's wonderful on a cool day. 

If you're ever in Las Vegas and want something scrumptious to start off your day - whether it's early in the morning or after noon ;) - don't hesitate to swing by Baguette Cafe. The food is tasty, the service is friendly, the environment is relaxing, and the coffee will get you going.

One visit to this place and we are hooked! We come here at least 3 times a month. I've tried their quiche, the Curry Chicken Sandwich, various Croissant sandwiches, the Tuna Salad, the and Chipotle Baguette Sandwich, everything is so good! The desserts are so worth the extra calories! I've tried pretty much all of the desserts and my favorite is the Chocolate Croissant Twist! They are always fresh and so so so good! My husband can't have enough of their coffee. I love the atmosphere, the guys that run the place are always so friendly and happy to serve their guests. Glad I found this place!
I was sick and really wanted some soup so I tried this place and it was ok.

**** THIS PLACE is the REAL DEAL!!! *****

This place has become known as BC (is what we refer to it as), they make and bake everything so yummy!!  Whether you're looking for a tasty morning snack, maybe a breakfast burrito or a muffin, or a lunch that involves a soup and sandwich, this place is off the shaaaaheezy.   Since my first experience here I have been a loyal fan.  

YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE!!!!!  And if you have, you already know... :P
This place is so good. Every time I go they make me my own custom baguette! Would highly recommend it :)

What a hidden gem! Friendly staff and great food - the best quiche I've ever tasted and the pastries are delicious! Good prices for the portion and quality of the food you get, even the coffee comes in a cup the size of a bowl :) very impressed!

Soups are all amazing .. Fresh daily from the father; sandwiches, salads and pastries from the mother to die for .. Nothing but great food from a family owned and operated business .. Tuna sandwich and cream of cauliflower soup and croissant are FAVs. Olivier could not be a more welcoming host!

Stopped by on our way through town. Although it's a bit off of the I-15, it was well worth the extra effort. Staff was wonderful and the food was outstanding. My prosciutto sandwich was amazing; will definitely be back!

This is a rather out-of-the-way place for me, but it has been on my radar for quite sometime. Finally made it out here with some friends, and Olivier didn't disappoint with his sandwiches and coffee. Got a large latte and the cups were huge - felt like I was bringing a mixing bowl to my face with every sip. But great coffee.

Got the egg, cheese, bacon on baguette. Nothing here is rocket science, but simplicity is elegance sometimes. Baguette was perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Ordered croissants and a parfait to go. Same results - fresh, buttery, flaky croissants and organic yogurt with fresh fruit.

I wish the ordering was a little speedier but it was okay because we weren't in a rush. Honestly, I'm not sure how often I'll be back here because of the location, but anytime I'm around, I'll probably stop by - maybe when Ikea opens up!
I can not explain how it feels to sit down and enjoy the vegan chipotle sandwich, its always an experience, the service the food the ambiance... I'm in love with this place.

Thank you fellow Yelpers, for this find.  I don't think I would  have stopped here if it weren't for all of the other great reviews, but I am so happy I did.  My chicken pesto panini was delicious and the service was great.

This place is a hidden gem.  It is nice to see a place where the owner still does all of the baking by scratch and takes meticulous care in the preparation of his food.  Olivier always greets you with a smile and describes all of the items that are available.  It is a refreshing change when compared to the rest of Las Vegas dining options.

It's always ridiculously awesome here and i have never experienced dessert so good that I started to weep until I discovered their honey cakes. Literally broke down in the cafe due to its perfection. It's overwhelming to never have a mediocre meal and I routinely drive across town to visit. You won't regret visiting !

Always a pleasure going to Baguette Cafe.  The owners are all very friendly & the food is great.  They have indoor & outdoor seating.  I've been there during lunch with it packed & for a quiet brunch on a Sunday morning.  Their quiche is top notch!  Croissants are the best I've had in town.  Adult recommended & children approved!  If looking for a taste of France, do stop in and try Baguette Cafe.  You won't be disappointed.

The first time I was ever here.  A little hard to find but worth the effort.  The food was delicious!  The quiche Lorraine was so flavorful and the crust so light and flaky! We had a large order and although it took a few separate trips to deliver it all we thoroughly enjoyed it. The pastries were so sweet and flaky and absolutely melt in your mouth! The owner and staff were so friendly and made us feel right at home.  The weather was just right for sitting in the lovely outdoor settling. The coffee,  expresso and tea were all very good. The croissant sandwiches were very light and flavorful.  This is definitely a place I will return to again and again and I recommend it to anyone looking for a sweet friendly little French cafe!

This was our last food stop in Vegas. The food and drinks were wonderful! It's a little tucked away behind some work buildings so it felt like a hidden treat. We ordered some delicious grilled sandwiches and dessert. What a great way to end a trip to Vegas!

How have I not reviewed Baguette Cafe yet?

First, let me start by saying the owner, Olivier, is from France. This place has the best little "Paris cafe" feel to it. Now for the food..

The Croissants are TO DIE FOR. I love coming in and smelling them when they just come out, they're seriously mouthwatering. I get the croissant breakfast sandwich and add turkey- its under $5, super filling and delicious. 

I've tried the fresh squeezed juices and I'm impressed with them all, you can tell they're actually fresh squeezed to order. 

And of course, The coffee and lattes don't disappoint.. But then again, nothing about Baguette Cafe disappoints.

You can never go wrong here with anything that you order. The staff is always friendly and willing to help you navigate thought the menu. They even recommend something that wasn't on the menu. The chipotle sandwich would have to be my favorite.

This place is awesome, the owner Oliver is super nice always helps out with suggestions. Everything always comes out tasting amazing and fresh. It's got a good amount of out door seating, kinda small indoors but that's what gives it that coziness. The only thing that stops me from giving it five stars is a lot of the other employees (not all) seem like they don't want to be there, they aren't very friendly and seem kinda confused. On multiple occasions there seems to be confusion about my order and slight attitude if I say anything. Other than that this place is awesome, definitely worth trying! I recommend their chicken sandwich with a white chocolate macadamia nut latte.

Had a craving for a croissant filled with meat, cheese, and egg while in Vegas. This place came on the top of the Yelp recommendation page. Neat little place tucked in a corner of a strip mall made of predominantly offices. Seats inside are kinda limited, but there are plenty of tables outside. Tried the ham and cheese croissant with a cup of cappuccino - both came out good! I don't think I could stay long in this place and not getting fat - I was about to buy every kind of baked goods they just pulled out from the oven all the time I was there.

I don't know what the big deal is about this place. My sandwich was mediocre. I had the Moroccan. I'd bite in and would just get a mouthful of veggies and sauce. I did like the bread and red bell peppers in the sandwich. Also, people said the owner was friendly. When I walked in, he looked directly at me without even smiling or greeting me. I still said hi and he replied. It wasn't very welcoming. I won't be returning. The place is overrated!

Moved here recently from Austin Texas, and very happy to have visited this wonderful cafe. If you enjoy travel, and like places with an "international vibe," you will probably enjoy this place! Pictures of Paris, French-speaking customers, eclectic music tracks ranging from rustic guitar rifts, Spanish vocals, to funky electronic, will bring a smile to your face. It was a bit of journey to find it, as it is tucked away, but well worth the effort. The owner/manager/barista (lol, busy guy!), "Oliver," makes you feel welcome right from the start. The coffee is top-notch, I usually get just plain drip with some cream. On the day I went, they were serving beans roasted by Anchois coffee Co FYI. They serve it in big, warm cups, served to your table. Lastly, the food selection is also fantastic. Great breakfast and lunch options. I had an Egg baguette Panini. Delicioso!
