The owner Oliver is fluent in French and makes time to sincerely interact with the customers, even those as amusing with my poor abuse of the French language:)  This bistro is cozy and genuine. Merci beaucoup Oliver.

My girlfriend and I tried this place out last week, and we enjoyed our experience.  The employees were friendly and offered help.

The coffee drink was good. And the sandwiches we ordered were very good. 

Location is a little strange, but we will definitely be back!

This place is a little expensive but I went here on a brunch date with my BF and we really enjoyed it. We both got breakfast sandwiches and then shared a coffee and a chocolate croissant. It was all super delicious and worth the money. Also, it was a cute little place, like I said, good for a date :)

How did I not stumble upon this amazing Baguette place?
Here's a short yet simple way on how I would describe this place.

+ Customer service
+ The aroma and smell
+ Affordable prices
+ Vegan friendly, many vegetable options
+ Fresh food
+ Very clean

I ended up getting a ham and swiss croissant because I had heard that the croissants are legendary! Perfect butter proportion, and the ham and cheese melted perfectly.

My friend had gotten a Pesto baguette, I didn't get a chance to try it but judging the look on her face she was extremely satisfied.

We ended up staying almost 2 whole hours!

I would most-def come back if only I lived closer!
Will be back soon!

Always the perfect start to a lazy Sunday! Staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Had the vegetable quiche of the day, but couldn't leave without fresh baked pastries as well! This hidden gem is so worth driving past the same-old pancake houses!

Came to baguette cafe this morning... 
Started with a Frappuccino ( 4/5 ) and a twisted chocolate pastrie.
Really cool place and nice people.
I definitely recommend.

Great place, great food, great atmosphere. Very laid back. Go enjoy a meal there!! Love the quiche!! Love coming here. A hidden little gem in Vegas. Open 7 days a week too. One of my new favorite places. Two big

As I sit here devouring an Egg & Ham Croissant sandwich and an Iced Chai, I wish I had discovered this place sooner. I've only been 3 times ever, & that's been in the past week. This place is a tucked away gem off Sunset and as soon as you walk in you get smacked in the face with the smell of fresh baked goods and coffee. The quiche here is TO DIE FOR. I had the veggie quiche and I must say, I don't know what the hell they put in it but it will be one of the most addicting quiches you'll ever have. Same goes to the egg on a croissant sandwich, which is delicious as well. Their pastries are also amazing. I'm obsessed with the Iced Chai which the man told me is sweetened with organic honey. It was love at first sip. And back to the man, I'm not quite sure of his name but he's so welcoming and always pays great attention to his customers. I wish they were open on weekends!!!! I can't wait to go back and try some of the salads and panini's!

Delicious food, nice outdoor seating.  When it's busy the service isn't spectacular, but all in all it's a nice spot off the highway where really only locals know about, and tourists can't get to.  The pastry is fresh and the coffee is great.  Try the salmon croissant

Was looking for some baguettes to make some BÃ¡nh mÃ¬. Google'd baguettes vegas and this popped up. Since I didn't know of any other places that sold Baguettes, I thought I give this place a try. No Yelp reviews either.

A pain in the arse to find. Buried in a sea of office space. What sucks is the only way to get to this place is taking Frontage Rd, which happens to be a 1 way street. So if you're coming from the west side of this place like me, you're going have to make a big circle to get to this place. Also, don't miss it, or you have to go around in circles. Be sure to have your navi if you suck with directions.

When I eventually found this place, I was the only one there, with another group of people who seem to work in one of the office space around the area. The place looked like it just opened. The chef is apparently French, but doesn't seem to have that heavy French accent, so you can understand him. 

The Ham Sandwich I got was served with a Baguette. Just a warning, this isn't the same French Baguettes that are super long. They are less than a foot long (I think). He made it fresh, so it took a little longer than if you were eating at Subway. He did tell me while I was waiting, just wish he told me before I ordered. The ham and greens of choice were very fresh. You can taste each individual ingredient and just yummy. Beats Subway and even Togos by far. Haven't tried Capriotti yet, so can't compare. My sandwich came out to $6 and some change which isn't too bad for what you're getting. 

They also have an illy espresso machine and illy branded cups. I'm not an espresso drinker so can't comment on those.

Bottom line, if you want something a lot better then Subway for a small premium and you can find this place, try it. Would get a 5 star, but had to knock it for its crappy location and the wait time till my sandwich was ready.

Delicious & friendly staff! The baguette used for the sandwich was extremely soft and the potato soup was perfect for today's gloomy weather. Only downside was that the coffee was slightly acidic/sour but that's only a preference. Will def be back for lunch soon

I just love the people who work here. Always so friendly.

I come here for the veggie quiche and a chai latte with almond milk. It is hard to find a good chai in this city and this is one of my favorites. The quiche is baked fresh daily and when its gone, its gone so get there early. At least this has been my experience. 

The reason I am giving four stars instead of 5 is the ambiance. I feel like the space could be updated and add some new touches. I like clean, open spaces and this place is a little dated and cold. It won't stop me from going back, just my personal opinion.

There are many reasons why Baguette Cafe is listed on Yelp's 100 best places to eat! This locally owned and family operated business is possibly the best breakfast place I've ever been to! Their croissants and quiche are made daily and they truly cannot be beat.

I ordered the Croissant & Egg with Ham which has swiss cheese omelette, spinach, tomato basil sauce, and ham. The croissant was flakey and delicious and the sandwich as a whole was savory with each flavor popping out of it. All of the ingredients are fresh and made-to-order.

The employees are all very friendly and knowledgeable. They can describe any menu item to you and probably give you some history behind why the item is on the menu too. Baguette Cafe offers daily specials as well. I'll be sure to stop here every time I am in Vegas.

This place and the owner is awesome! Everything on the menu taste amazing and there is no guilt trip when eating it. All ingredients are organic and for you soda drinkers even the soda is organic. This place is a must and the owner will always remember you.
This place is awesome! Great breakfast joint if you're not looking for quantity but quality. The owner is super cool and I love supporting small businesses. I feel like I'm in Paris here!

I pretty much order the same thing here every time I come, which is a croissant and egg with bacon. I loooveeeee their croissant. It's probably the best I've had in Vegas. I am, however, trying all of their coffee. My favorite one so far is the cafe mocha with toasted almond and caramel. It is to die for! Their chocolate twist is amazingggg. 

The customer service they provide is an easy 5 stars. They are so nice and incredibly welcoming. 

This is my favorite cafe. They have good food and good customer service. Can't really ask for more.

Order Vanilla Latte 1 Full Prosciutto Sandwich, Croissant and Pain Aux Raisins best place for Croissant, crew very friendly and nice. Good Food and Drink for rainy afternoon. Not going to eat them all I am sharing......Lol....

My wife and I ate there this morning; I had a three-egg, Black Forest ham-and cheese omlette with one of their buttery croissant; my wife opted for the fresh-out-of-the-oven quiche Lorraine. Both were delicious, both came with side spinach salads, and all portions were lareg enough to take a bit home. In addition, owner Olivier and his chef-mother, Claudine, are charming, lovely people. We'll be going back to try some of the lunch sandwiches.

(Oh -- don't be put off by the fact that the cafe is a little hard to find; you have to turn right into a large business park, turn left to the far end of the park, and then serpentine your way to the far back of the park to find the restaurant.)

The best breakfast place I have been to! 

Although this place is hidden in between business centers and is a little confusing to find at first - their customer service and food makes everything worthwhile. 

When I first walked in, it was a quiet cafe (reminded me of Starbucks for a moment). As soon as I looked at the menu, Oliver came and introduced himself and is quiet the charmer I must say!

Very observant and easy going, he was eager to introduce me to the menu and what they were making that day. Although I only ordered their croissants and their black iced tea I was impressed with the enthusiam and how fresh their food was. 

The croissants were crispy and warm on the inside. I had their chocolate croissant and their cranberry with vanilla croissant. The chocolate croissant was not too strong and very filling. Their cranberry with vanilla croissant was sweet but had a sour kick to it. 

If you need a pick me up and want to go to an atmosphere where they will make you smile and want to start your day right - it's Baguette Cafe! 

I am definitely coming back here to try their lunch menu :)

Talk about a Nevada gem. By far one of my favorite spots in Las Vegas region. Delicious. I want to buy a house here just so I could access this place at a convenient distance. 

The cafe is located in a commercial area.  The owner did a good job at making the inside and outside patio area adorable. It has a French ambiance. It is cute. 

As you walk in the owner greets you. He is so nice and so helpful. He is warm. His customer service skills is really remarkable. 

Everything here is made fresh, and as a customer you have the opportunity to see it. When I got there the owner was taking out  fresh croissants from the oven. 

I had half a Moroccan sandwich and half roasted bell pepper soup. Both were fantastic. For both I paid $8.45 

I am knocking off a point for their smoothies. I ordered a mango strawberry smoothie. Although it had the authentic taste of mango, it tasted like a frozen snapple. It had a very icy consistency, not smooth or creamy. It was more of a slush then anything. It costs about 4.50. It was disappointing. I definitely wouldn't order that again or recommend it. 

Overall I would come back here in a heart beat and bring all my friends I want to try everything ( other than the smoothies)! Looking forward to coming back.

On our recent trips to Las Vegas we always ponder where to have our first breakfast and we always end up at Baguette Cafe.  Olivier's mom was taking the orders this morning plus multi tasking by handling some of the kitchen duties.  My wife got her usual small, 16 ounce, coffee while went caffeine free by requesting ice water.  There were 3 different quiches available, but we settled on usual and ordered the vegetarian with side salads. Creamy deliciousness.  As we exited, fat and happy, Olivier thanked us for our business.  

4.5 Stars rating would be most appropriate.

Awesome place to grab breakfast or lunch. The owner is always there and is incredibly friendly and nice. The food is amazingly good and very affordable. A true gem for a city that lacks a lot of good small cafes

The cafe is a little tricky to find even though you can see it from the freeway, but just drive in from Durango and Sunset and you'll find it in the business complex eventually. It was surprisingly busy (great place for your workday lunch break) and a line to order. Fortunately, we were able to snag a table as well.

I ordered with very friendly Oliver. He makes you feel welcome and as if you're in his home. After I had placed my order and sat down, he brought our food to the table. 

I opted for a Quiche Lorraine with Salad ($7). The quiche was delicious. Definitely one of the better quiches I've had in town. The salad was nice, too.

My only complaint is how busy it can be and especially how difficult it is to get a seat. However, I love the accessibility of tasty French cafÃ© eats in this area.
Everything is fresh from the sandwiches to the soups. Maybe a little on the pricey side but quality food.

Love this place. I wish it was open on the weekend.  My cafe mocha was a tad too sweet and hard to finish but that is my only complaint.  The herbal teas are beautiful and croissants are very special.

I LOVE the Baguette Cafe! I'm not always in the area, but when I am I always try to stop in. It's a small place with counter service, but it's the closest I've come to real French food in Las Vegas. Yep, that's what I said. This little place is super authentic. It reminds me very much of cafes in France.

Everything I've had off the menu, from salads to sandwiches, quiches to desserts, has been delicious and of the highest quality. Service is always friendly. 

The only downside is that it gets busy and sometimes it's tough to get a table. But, from the owner's standpoint, that's a GOOD problem to have. :)

This is one of my most highly recommended restaurants in Las Vegas. If you haven't been here, most definitely give it a shot.

Delicious food at a great price!  I can see why this place is so popular.  I started simple for my first meal: Croissant Egg sandwich and an iced black tea.  

What really made this sandwich so above average was the croissant.  Not only was it fresh and delicious, but it was authentic.  It's hard to find good breads/baking in Las Vegas for some reasons, so the croissant really made the sandwich. 

There are tons of really great sounding items on the menu that I can't wait to try.  I'm a fan of quiche and they have a daily one each day, plus a wonderful array of pastries.

If only I was able to give them more starts. This place is THAT good! 
I usually order the curry chicken sandwich w a organic green tree and oh my $&:xbs- the meal is to die for... Makes me debate whether or not to get more than 1 order. 

Oh and did I mention he owner is behind the register! Such a nice guy friendly guy!
Friendly service, clean environment. Took 23 minutes for me to get a latte. Coffee was just okay...
Very solid sandwich and soup.  It's in the back of a large business park.  Good spot for lunch and has outdoor seating.

I almost don't want to write about this place.
Somehow everyone is so fascinated, but me!

Went there for lunch. First time, so it wasn't easy to find it. Only thing that helped me to get there that I saw the sign from the freeway many times!

My BF and I both ordered the Grilled eggplant panini with extra turkey added. And for drinks, he ordered iced tea, and for me hazelnut cappuccino.

After we paid, went outside to find table. They were plenty of empty places, but dirty. One after another, all dirty tables. Finally got a table next to the entrance, got napkins and wiped off the table.
About 15 minutes later we got served.
Everything looked good!
I took the first bite, and struggled. Then I realized I am fighting a big piece of paper from my sandwich.
Immediately went inside, asked people in line to excuse me to go front. I showed my food to the cashier. He immediately took it from me, and gave it to the cook. The cook said, OH IT'S ONLY PAPER FROM MEAT. I said, okay, but it's not supposed to be served! Cook gave me a dirty look, didn't want to fix the problem. Well, I asked again, WOULD YOU EXPECT ME TO EAT THE PAPER? 
Finally the cashier told him to make a new sandwich!
I couldn't watch him prepare the new sandwich, I returned to my table. Very soon my food arrived. Honestly, I really lost my appetite!
I kind of forced myself to try and eat, since I was hungry.
After other customers left from the neighboring tables, the cashier came to us. He apologized, said SORRY many times, apologized for the cook's behavior, too.

Bottom line: IT IS VERY RUDE TO DENIAL ABOUT WRONGDOING! The cook was very rude!

Panini was tasty for the second time.
My cappuccino didn't taste hazelnut at all!
My BF asked for refills on his iced tea, and the busboy said he doesn't know if it's any refills.
Well ... ask someone then! But NO ... he never returned!

I guess I won't return to this place either!
Fantastic cafe food, sandwiches, salads and soup. Olivier, the host is super friendly and accomodating to your specific food needs. 5 STARS for sure, try it out!

I love this place. Okay, I admit:

1) it's in a random location
2) it doesn't have that cafe ambiance THAT much
3) it's sooo far

BUT
Legit baguette bread? CHECK. At one point, I grew up on french style baguette. I can taste it when it's store bought or made with TLC. And here it's made with TLC. All the food is. Food here is an art and I absolutely love it. AND it tastes great and healthy. 

Great marinated chicken-CHECK
Fresh ingredients--CHECK

The owner is actually from France and we shared a bonding moment when I saw he had Vietnamese fish sauce (Vietnamese food IS french and Chinese fusion basically).  He is such a sweet heart and they have great service. So worth the drive.

I'm giving the food four stars and boosting another star for the owner's passion and personality.  Oliver could not have been more patient, friendly and helpful during our first visit.  Warning, this is not a coffee house where you can get your cup 'o' joe in less than 30 seconds.  At first I felt a little guilty when he was explaining their menu items in full detail and asking where we were from, but I quickly realized that the folks line understood that this is a place to relax, engage in a little conversation, get fresh pastries or breakfast and hang for as long as you want.

Rarely, do you get an instant feeling that you are at a place where the owners love what they do and puts ttotal passion into it.  The employees equally present themselves the same way.  I had the feelilng that I was at a small Parisian Cafe in the middle of a desert.

I love this French Restaurant! Everything is so good! Their quiche are great! The croissants are amazing and all their baked goods are fresh. You must check this place out for French food or just want to relax at a cafe. Excellent restaurant!
I would definitely come back.  Curry quiche, prosciutto sandwich, chocolate twist croissants, good service

Pastries and coffee, their food is so amazing. I craveeee them when they are closed! Dog friendly and they are proud of their establishment, as they should be! I love the chocolate twist, croissant egg sandwich, acai granola bowl, chocolate puffs, and vast array of coffee selection. I would give them 10 stars if I could! Happy they're now open on weekends by the way!!

Omgeeeee..... Amazing !!! The freshest panini I've ever got... I ordered the Moroccan with eggplant, so good. Was hard to study because I kept smelling the fresh bread bake in the background. Definitely recommend

GOOD
A little gem nestled away in-between Durango and Buffalo off Sunset.  Located on Rafael Rivera way...(by no regrets bar)
I can't say enough good things about this place...you can eat inside or outside the cafe.  The croissants and quiches are outrageously good and priced just right.
Staff and ambiance are just what you are looking for to have a nice breakfast/brunch with friends or as a couple.  
You order up front and take a number...(similar to Cafe Leon's) wait was minimal for as busy as it was...first come first serve tables.

BAD
Only 1 server bringing out food to tables...she looked overwhelmed but extremely cheerful and attentive to everyone...

P.s. the croissants are so good...best I've had in town.  Better than patisserie manon bakery...just saying =)  great job to your team baguette cafe...5 stars all around

Nearly everything is good here. I can't say everything because I haven't tried everything. 

Things I thought were amazing and to write home about: celery soup, prosciutto salad, chipotle, banana nut muffin. 

There will be more... 
Yes, service can be slow, but good food comes to those who wait!
Legit coffee shop with great sandwiches.
Great quaint little bistro with flavorful goodies. Me an the hubby really enjoyed our brunch.

Had my first and second experience at Baguette Cafe today.  I'll most likely stop by tomorrow too.  I got a Eggplant Panini and a Caramel Macchiato.  The Quiche was still 17 mins out.   Also got a couple of fresh Croissants and a Raisin Croissant.  Both were awesome. 

 I rarely find a place I like this much so this was a treat.  this is definitely a new favorite.  After talking with Olivier (I hope I got his name right) I found out that their Dough is imported from France.  Very nice with an excellent price.

Stopped by later on to get some of that Quiche and some Apple Tart.  The Quiche was excellent and I'll be having sweet dreams of that Tart.  Got the last Croissant of the day, lucky.  The rest of the menu looked awesome and I am exited to try it all.
Great cafe and delicious food! Customer service was friendly. Would definitely go to this place again. A+

HELLO to THE BEST BREAKFAST PLACE IN VEGAS BY FAR!!!  I am so relieved to have found you, Baguette Cafe.  Quality and choices of dishes are nice, refreshing, and perfect in portion.  Service was stellar...so attentive and friendly.  The coffee...wow!  A perfect cup, aroma and flavor. And as far as the French aspect, I did feel like I was back in Paris in regards to quality of food and ambiance.  Baguette Cafe is a hidden gem...one that I'm looking forward to going back to again and again.

The sandwich and the atmosphere was pretty good. We had a "fawlty towers" moment which was hillarious. Total of 3 or 4 customers, our order was brought wrong twice and once we started eating, they tried to bring us another tables order as well. A " Fawlty Towers" fan would understand:)))

Best quiche I ever had! The chi tea real, the smell of this place tells you that you are in the right place!!! I wish I lived in this state but any time I am in town this is the place I will come!!!!!!! Absolutely loved it!!!

I have ordered a few times from Baguette Cafe and was not disappointed! Today I ordered a egg croissant and it was delectable. It had the right amount of everything. The customer service was awesome too. I'll definitely be going back and I suggest you should too!
Very authentic french food and pastries. Food is delicious and fresh. I recommend most likely everything on the menu :)
This cafÃ© is always buzzing in a good way. The vegan options are the pesto sandwich and the chipotle sandwich. Both are amazing. They also have vegan soups available daily.

Preface that this three star rating is based off of two visits within the past week. First visit was good and a solid four star experience with yummy food and good customer service. My second visit was less than okay due to the staff completely forgetting my order and waiting over 30 minutes for a sandwich togo. Mistakes happen, but it wasn't very busy at the restaurant. The staff apologized though and gave me a free pastry so all is forgiven! Make sure you check out their soups of the day because holy guacamole is the Normandy soup BOMB!

Awesome spot!!!! I had a chipotle panini with mushroom (made to perfection) , a cup of cream with turnip with asiago cheese, totally loved this soup, and a fresh made watermelon/lemonade. We ordered at the counter but the food runner who btw was super friendly and pleasant! brought our lunches to our table, the weather was awesome so we sat outside.. The food, the servers, the ambience, a total package... A place I highly recommend.

Chocolate croissant was fluffy, light, and delicious. I could eat 60 or 70 of those...Coffe was delicious as well.

Very friendly service. Very clean place. A little tough to find, but there's a map in the Yelp photos. 

Directions: Basically, go to where you GPS takes you, but head straight to the back center of the parking lot. When you are by the highway, you are very close...

I've been on the lookout for some authentic local eateries and when I saw Baguette Cafe pop up on Yelp I had to give the place a try.

As has been noted by some other reviewers, its a little tricky to find the place at first, in the far corner of a group of office buildings, but its well worth the effort.

I got there about 11:40 am which I think was perfect timing, since by the time my food came out almost every seat in the place was taken. The decor is very nice - simple but beautiful.  Normally small local cafes look pretty amateurish inside, but Baguette Cafe was done right.  Its warm and inviting and definitely a place you'd like to eat at or just have a cup of coffee in. 

I decided to have a ham sandwich and a cup of their roasted pepper and gouda soup, both of which were very good.  I don't normally care for tomatoes but the sandwich was good enough that I actually enjoyed them.  The presentation of the plate was also very nice, with plates and bowls that were a cut above what you'd expect to find in most Vegas cafes.

Olivier, whom I take to the owner, was very nice and welcoming, introducing himself and asking me which nearby building I worked in (none of them, I live down the street) and asking my name when I left and shaking my hand - something you definitely don't get at most restaurants or cafes!

All in all I'm very impressed with Baguette Cafe and recommend anyone in the area (or out of it, its worth a drive) to give it a try.

My goal is to check out at least one of Yelp's 100 every time I leave the island so this trip to Vegas took me straight to Cafe Baguette from the airport. 

I was greeted by the owner, Olivier, a very nice man who introduced me to the rest of the staff that day. Being it was my first time, he recommended the egg and croissant. I ordered mine with ham and also ordered a latte and a chocolate twist. 

The croissant was excellent, so buttery and flaky. It was a delicious sandwich. My latte was yummy as well, especially because it was made with whole milk and I usually get mine nonfat. Baguette Cafe only offers whole milk, almond milk and soy milk. 

The chocolate twist, although amazing, was too sweet for me and I couldn't finish it.  I think I would have loved the chocolate croissant.  

I really enjoyed the warm ambience of the cafe.  Such friendly service made breakfast a delight!
This place is amazing! The croissants are so soft and flaky. It is a busy little place and I will most definitely return.

When evaluating a restaurant I take into account all aspects. The location is a bit odd but that's fine. I ordered the ham and cheese croissant and a bottled water. I don't remeber exactly the cost but it was pricey for what I got. I then sat there for 15 minutes and people that came in after me were getting their orders before me. I finally get my order which I suspect was sitting on the counter at least 5 minutes and it was heated poorly I mean come on 15 minutes for a semi warm croissant? That's pretty poor. It wasn't very busy either. And the staff gave off an aura of laziness. So overall...poor customer service,poor attention to what they are serving and what appeared to be random favoritism in getting what I ordered = not impressed and will not be returning.

1st time there, from Az.  Olivier, his mom, and the rest of the staff were terrific!  They took time to explain what they have and what they do.  Baguette bread and croissants baked fresh every 40-45 minutes.  We had the most delicious sandwiches!  The day was really nice so we sat outside. Olivier even took time to chat with me for a bit and was helpful.  Definitely a place to go!  If you pass it up, there is something to be said about your intelligence!

One of my most favorite spots in Vegas. Wish I would have found it sooner! The staff is amazing, I believe Oliver is the owner & he is always so welcoming & sweet. I have been here 5 times now & the food is always consistently amazing. Always fresh ingredients. My tummy & spirits are always happy when I leave here!

We've been coming here since October of last year.  You know it's authentic French cuisine when the staff all speaks English with a thick French accent.  My husband really enjoys coming here and speaking his native language.  

We've enjoyed everything so far.  Fresh ham & cheese sandwich, quiches, croissants, panties, and lattes.  There is usually a line going on.  I would suggest to come a little bit earlier before lunch or late lunch.  There is a bit of a wait.  So worth it if you're not in a rush.

it's away from the strip, which we didn't expect, in a business park. We had the prosciutto salad and spicy chipotle sandwich. Both DELICIOUS!!! I wish there was one of these in San Diego. Everything was super fresh and just tasted so great. We also had the Broccoli chedder soup which was a bit different because it was blended into a puree, still delicious!!

Lived up to the hype. 
Just had the Moroccan chicken and the ham sandwich with a mango smoothie. Every bite  satisfied my taste buds. Fresh ingredients and simplistic style. There also a reason why they call it the baguette cafe. The baguette the sandwiches is are on is perfect.
Great food! Been coming her for years, I usually order a breakfast egg croissant and an ice latte with almond milk.

I wish there were more of these, and I wish one of them were in my area of Las Vegas, because Baguette Cafe is my kind of place!  While it is located in a business plaza in Southwest Las Vegas, it is the best cafe I have been to in town.  The sandwiches are what brought me here, and it is what will bring me back.  

The service was very friendly and attentive.  The owner, Olivier, is a UNLV graduate, something we both had in common.  After talking to him for a little while, I found out he has worked as manager at some of the top places on the strip (Aureole, Bouchon, Joel Robuchon).  You could tell that he knew his food, because the sandwich I had was top notch.  
One of his suggestions was the Chipotle Chicken Sandwich, so I thought that sounded great.  They brought out the sandwich on a glass plate, with a real fork.  It even came with a small side salad, which was very nice.  I think next time I may also try one of their soups.  

I will be going back to Baguette Cafe soon and often, and suggest that you go too!

I stopped in here after getting into Vegas from California. I was famished and just wanted s simple veggie sandwich. BIG MISTAKE. 
There was nobody in line. Multiple tables needed to be cleaned off..I was noticing when it took the girl over 10 minutes to put in my order but then had to go get the owners help to ring it in correctly..which is fine) but it was an episode long. They didn't ask whether it was for here or to go. I was planning on eating it there. So I go find a table to relax and sit down and hopefully eat a good sandwich. Then I hear someone yelling, "Do you want it for here or to go?" Huhhhhh???? Walk over to me and ask..how about that! Anyway..sandwich came and if you enjoy oxidized avocado you would have enjoyed the sandwich. Soup was shit. Anyway...I'm truly not one to say anything but I'm a Chef and the whole experience was a shit show and the food was not worth any kind of trip there.

Living in LV for a yr now, ive driven by the place a million times.. Finally made my way over today- omg wish i would've came sooner. Being born in France & Educated in Italy, im VERY picky when it comes to food being"labeled" french or Italian made. But Olivier is the REAL DEAL!! I bought a Pain au Raisin( raisin bread/croissant), thinking it would b close but WOW, it brought me back to my childhood w/my grandmother@the boulangerie(bakery). While Olivier was speaking to my husband, i looked over the menu, and cant wait to try everything and will def be back!! Merci Olivier pour avoir amenÃ© un tout petit peu de la France ici

Just stopped by Baguette Cafe for the first time for lunch. I normally see it from the freeway when I drive home and this afternoon I was craving a tasty, warm sandwich. When I first got there I felt a bit out of place in my crop top and high-waisted shorts, which is my go-to casual wear. In a cafe full of businessmen and women, I felt that I should've worn my business casual wear. I tried to make conversation with a couple of people in line and they actually just stared at me like I was crazy. 

So after feeling a bit awkward, I was kindly greeted by Olivier. He was so kind, asked me my name and even used my name twice before I took off. I didn't feel out of place any longer, I felt welcome. I ordered the Pesto grilled sandwich with chicken and bacon which was just absolutely delicious! Throughout my short wait for my to-go order I encountered such friendly staff. They were all working hard to get not only everyone's order but I felt like they were trying to specifically get me my order quick and with such wonderful hospitality. I left the place in such a great mood because of the environment they created for me. From someone that works in the hospitality industry, I can tell you that they do it with such ease and they are so real. On top of that, the food was delicious. I cannot wait to go back and try more!
Hidden secret great little coffee place with yummy french goodies.

I found this place on Yelp.  Drove by it a thousand times but don't think of going into a business park for lunch.  The soups were amazing, homemade salad dressing on the crispy greens, and delicious curry chicken sandwich.  The staff was excellent, friendly, and accommodating.  They pointed out their large courtyard perfect for children and dogs.  Definitely will be returning!

This place is right down the street from my house, so it's very convenient for me to escape and come here for some study time.  The service is excellent, the food is delicious in presentation, and flavor, and the ambiance is very relaxed and comfortable.  The quality of the food and coffee is as good as it gets around here. By far my favorite local spot, and definitely the top of my list overall for the Las Vegas area.
Everything I order is always delish.  Just wish I could get the chocolate tart every time I go!  I get there later in the day and it's all sold out.  :-)

Get here early for their delicious and wonderful quiche! 

They tend to run out, and they do make em fresh, so its worth waking up early. Every latte's I have tried have been perfect, and that chocolate twist is to die for. 

I like how its small and hidden within this huge plaza. So it might be hard to find the place if you haven't been. 

The customer service is simply on point. Every time I'm there, I see every one smiling and hustling. I love it! Everyone's so helpful and awake. Havent seen a grump just yet. Also, I witnessed an accident once and fortunately the girl who was apart of the accident didn't mind too much. I believe the girl spilled some coffee, and broke a cup. I believe the owner came out to apologize and accommodate them as much as he can. People make mistakes, and I'm glad the customer wasn't infuriated.

The place itself is small, but there is a ton of outside seating. On a nice beautiful day, sit outside with your coffee and munch of some pastry. It's simply delightful. Even with the French music playing. 

It's simple, delicious, customer service is A+, and a great experience. I even saw a family come in from out of town. They said they saw the reviews on here and wanted to try it out. They were all happy! They said it out loud. Haha. 


I recommend, most definitely

I will give it a 4.5 stars. We came in on Monday right at lunch time expecting it to be crazy, but it wasn't so we were able to order and grab a seat out on the patio. 

Olivier was ringing people up and he was super friendly. The cafe itself is small, cute, and clean. I loved the patio seating. Even though it's located in a business center, you don't really feel like it at all. 

I ordered the Blue Brie and leek-potato soup. My bf ordered he Moroccan and a smoothie. Everything was delicious! I LOVE the bread the sandwiches come on. I guess they make it fresh daily. It has a nice crisp on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. It's just perfect for sandwiches. Both sandwiches were great but I preferred the blue brie. I really want to try the Chipotle the next time I go. 

The food is all very flavorful and tastes fresh. It's a great little spot and can't wait to go back.

It's awesome, had the Prosciutto Salad and Shrimp Bisque soup.  Both were excellent fresh greens and Parmesan cheese in the salad and mmm mmm good salad dressing.  The bisque was fresh and good (not doing back-flips about it, but it was good).  Also had the bread pudding with a cup of white mocha coffee.  Bread pudding was chilled but very tasty (I prefer my bread pudding warm) and the white mocha coffee was excellent with dessert!  Definitely will go here again.   Check it out you won't be disappointed.

Nice little coffee shop with a good selection of breakfast and lunch items. Baguette Omelette sandwich was good, bread was fresh and crunchy. Croissant sandwiches were a good size. Server was nice and apologized for the missing bacon fiasco. I'll comeback to their pastries.

I love this place for breakfast or brunch! Try to get there early or the lines are a little long and seating can be challenging, but aside from that the food is absolutely amazing for breakfast and lunch. All fresh all amazing! They also use Illy coffee which is my favorite and make a delicious roasted almond Mocha. Try the quiche or the breakfast you will not be disappointed.

This place is a real hidden gem - the thing I like most is that everything is fresh and the food is authentic. I didn't get to try any of the pastries, but ordered an amazing chef salad and mushroom soup. They're very busy at lunchtime so had a little bit of a wait - but really enjoyed checking it out. It's about 5 minutes from my office so will definitely go by again when I have the time. I would've loved to sit on the patio - but they were all full - like I said pretty busy. Definitely want to try the pastries soon, so i am going back for sure!

I recently visited Baguette Cafe for a quick pastry (Palmier $3.30) and latte (20oz $4.44) to go; fortunately after inhaling the refreshing aroma of perfection I ended up purchasing a croissant & egg ($4.50) as well! Spinach, tomato, basil accompanied by Monterrey jack cheese inside of a fresh croissant was heavenly. I'll definitely be back soon to explore their menu further!!

This place is LEGIT! Great breakfast and perfect coffee. The owner is clearly doing what he loves, and pours the passion into his menu. Ate the Quiche and the egg panni. Croissant was as good as one straight from a Paris Bistro.

Baguette Cafe is what I consider the perfect spot for breakfast. Great customer service, wide range of French sweet and savory items, exceptional quality, and affordable. We were here this morning around opening time - 9am on the weekends- and there were already several people in line and sitting outside. The outdoor seating is spacious and cute, I'd love to come back with a friend and hang out for lunch or just coffee and dessert. You can't go wrong with a croissant anything, we got the croissant ham egg and Swiss, croissant and egg, and the veggie quiche. Everything was great, I can't wait until next time!

Excellent service,  nice atmosphere, friendly staff.  The food is phenomenal.  Soups and sandwiches are made with the best ingredients,  haven't tried the pastries but they look great.  Highly recommended

Excellent food and service. 

Their croissant, ham, and cheese sandwich is always so tasty. 

The quiche are always made the day of and is a must try. 

What I like about this place is they have a huge variety from pastries to acai bowls. I can come here and order either a healthy bowl of organic granola bowl or one of their yummy pastries. They also make fresh juices and smoothies.

Awesome little spot. 
The croissant was perfect, the latte was great. 
The only thing, is my girlfriend noticed he served other guests before coming to me, even though I was first. 
It didn't bother me, but I did wish I had my drink before/during my meal.

CROISSANTS LOVERS REUNITE!

I couldn't help myself from stepping into this place everyday while attending classes inside the building right across. The fact that I'm anticipating to eat lunch there everyday should justify my statement.

I love croissants and I've had them in a number of places, including France; and I haven't found a place that does it right than Baguette Cafe (in Vegas). Light, airy, buttery and not to mention FRESH, it baffles me on how they won't initiate a dozen deal by now.

Aside from the obvious obsession, the sandwiches and salads are up to par as well. The Chicken Salad/Sandwich is my go-to choices whenever I'm starving but I'm always sure to try the others whenever the time calls for it. And as other reviews have stated, be prepared to wait in line prior to and after ordering- as everything is made to order.

The staff is friendly and there's multiple seating arrangements outside whenever it's a packed house.  Last tip? Be sure to order a couple croissants at a time. One won't satisfy your day.

This has to be one of Vegas's hidden gems. If you haven't tried their homemade soups yet I suggest you do they are incredible. I would eat here everyday if I could I love it that much. Oliver is so gracious and you can tell that the entire family takes such pride in the food they prepare. I have tried almost every sandwich on the menu and they are all great. The bread is always fresh. The dressing on the salad that accompanies the sandwiches is to die for. They should bottle and sell it. I am lucky enough to work close to here but wish I lived closer. It is so good that I will sometimes order enough to take home for dinner.

My daughter has a fascination with everything French! So of course we had to check out Baguette Cafe! Plus it's in our neighborhood. We shared a 3 cheese baguette sandwich with chicken and I had a white chocolate macadamia cookie latte! DELISH!!!! The food is fresh, made from scratch and that latte ROCKED! We will definitely be back!

I love this little cafe.  Not only are the salads with homemade dressing fabulous but the quiche, soups and panini sandwiches very good as well.  The croissants and other pastries are wonderful.  The only downside is they are closed on weekends.  This little cafe is located in a strip mall within a mid rise business park thus the reason it is only open weekends.  Outside seating is a nice feature as well for breakfast or lunch.

Baguette Cafe is one my favorite lunch spots.  It's nested between a bunch of office complexes and has little signage on Sunset, but definitely worth the hunt if you are in the area.  They open up the patio seating during the warmer seasons.

They serve healthy French sandwiches and juices.  I've had several of their sandwiches and they've all been excellent.  Portion size is "just right" and leaves you with room for dessert.   

Partly due to their excellent food, the place is always packed and it's sometimes hard to find a space to sit.  I recommend going during slightly off hours to avoid the lunch rush.

Great little spot, out of the way off the freeway. Worth giving it a shot. Hard to go if you dont work in the area. Tried the tuna sandwich based on the reviews here, wasnt too impressed, but it was still good.  Chicken pesto warm sandwich was very good. Winter soup, amazing. Illy coffee, fantastic. Service, the best.

This place is kinda out of the way but definitely worth it. Stopped in real quick this morning to grab breakfast before work and was greeted immediately with welcomes and good mornings! Everything looked delicious and since I came in right after opening everything was fresh! The croissants were absolutely beautiful!!! I played it safe and ordered a ham and Swiss croissant. It was inexpensive and totally worth every penny! The croissant was flaky, fall apart, melt in your Mouth buttery-ness. The ham and Swiss the two perfect additions. They melt the Swiss cheese on top of the ham in the oven. My favorite part was when another customer walks in and exclaims "it smells great in here" and the guy taking her order is quick to reply "it's called baguette no. 5 it's like Chanel but better!" Totally hilarious and showed that he really enjoys his job! Can't wait to take my hubby with me next time!

Went to eat here for breakfast with the boyfriend and we've been wanting to eat here for a while.

I got The Pesto (pictured) with an iced green tea and he got The Curry with a peach smoothie. Our total came to around $25 and I thought it was a bit pricey.

The people are very nice and professional and they make their customers feel at home. The miss at the counter broke down the menu for us because it was our first time. The ambiance is nice as well and it gave the feeling of "lay back and relax". 

The Pesto was amazing. The baguette was nice to the crunch and the rest of the sandwich fell into place. I had a bite of The Curry and that was even more amazing. 

I recommend this place to people if they're looking for good food with good company.

Soooooo delicious! oh my goodness! the white chocolate mocha was delicious and so was the chocolate croissant! The staff was so nice and not to mention good looking lol ( especially the one that looked like Adam Levine but with a French accent ). Wish I lived closer to have this everyday!

Bread & pastry is outstanding! We had a Tuna sandwich which was just passable. Ambiance was truly pleasant with both indoor and outdoor seating. They made an OUTSTANDING cup of fresh drip coffee! I would come back for coffee/tea and a pastry.
Delicious quaint amazing service is a little slower how ever food speaks for its self

Came to try the croissants.  Easily the best I've had in Vegas.  Lots of buttery layers and the perfect amount of flakiness on the outside. The place is a bit out of the way but worth the trip for the croissants alone.

Jessie B had been telling me about this Brie sandwich that Baguette Cafe had. I love anything with Brie so when we had one of our lunch dates we met up here. 

Baguette Cafe offers indoor and outdoor seating which I love. Their menu looks so good! They have tons of vegetarian and vegan options as well. They also offer amazing fresh soups daily. We both ordered the Blue and Brie sandwich with mushrooms. Baguette gives you the option of mushrooms or chicken on this sandwich. 

Since it was such a nice day we ate outside. They have plenty of seating outside among the trees almost makes you forget your in a business complex. They offer benched seating as well as single seats covered in cushions.

Our food came out quickly. Our sandwiches were accompanied by a small side salad with a house vinaigrette. Super tasty and I loved the tang it had. Now that sandwich!!!! Yummy! The bread which was perfectly toasted and I'm pretty sure was home made. It was the perfect vehicle for all the cheesey goodness. There was a layer of sautÃ©ed mushrooms and onions. Next came a little blue cheese and a thick slice of melty Brie! I couldn't help but eat the whole thing. 

Although Baguette Cafe is pretty far from where I live the food is that good I'd drive that far to eat there again. I'd love to try another sandwich or some of their homemade soups. Love it!

My friend really, really loved their coffee. 
My friends also thought their sandwiches were good. 
I was disappointed with the vegan sandwich. It was boring, flavorless and more bread than anything.
This place is probably wonderful if you're looking for some really legit, high quality coffee, but if you're vegan- maybe try the other awesome vegan restaurants out there.

The food was excellent. I had the Chipotle sandwich with chicken and loved it. We also shared a chocolate tarte and that was wonderful. We went at 11:30 to avoid the lunch rush which was great because by the time we left there was a line out the door. I'd say the service is a bit slow - it took 15 min. to order and only one person in front of us. And they need to do a better job bussing the tables and cleaning up. Maybe short staffed? But prices were very reasonable and food was great.

(My 400th review...Woot, woot!)

During our most recent adventure to Vegas, we were in search for another great sandwich place and we ended going to Baguette Cafe.  Yeah, it was a little out of the way from the Strip, not to mention, it's located deep inside a business park.  Thankfully, I noticed the sign on their building while on the 215 so it wasn't that hard to figure out.

We got there around 11am on Tuesday and it was empty, we figured we'd beat the lunch rush.  The gentleman who helped us, we didn't get his name but I'm assuming he's the infamous Olivier, was quite hospitable.  He asked if we've been there before, offered suggestions and went through all the menu items we were curious about.  In the end, I ordered the Blue Brie Panini and the s/o ordered the Chipotle Chicken Panini.  With one bottled soda and one Iced Tea it all came out to just under $20.  I noticed they had Illy Coffee too, which is awesome but it was too warm to drink coffee. :)

It took awhile for our sandwiches to be made, not sure why.  However, I did notice that their phone kept ringing and Olivier would give each caller the undivided attention that he provided us.  Yeah, that's awesome but at the same time, customers were starting to line up and wait.

When our sandwiches came out, the presentation was nice.  It came with a couple leaves of greens, the s/o said it was a salad because it had dressing, but IMO, it was a garnish but wow, it was tasty.  It would've been nice to have larger portion.

The s/o and I split our sandwiches to experience both.  My Blue Brie was pretty awesome!  The turkey was poached so, it's not your cold cut turkey, so it tasted quite fresh.  It also had apples and walnuts.  I absolutely loved it!  The Chipotle Chicken was good, just a little too spicy for me, hence "Chipotle" but who can hate on a sandwich with bacon in it?  The bread however is totally what made both Paninis, it rocked!  They baguette was freshly baked and served warm, yum!  Eat your heart our Subway and your "Eat Fresh" slogan, this is the real deal!

Overall, Baguette Cafe is a cute little place that I would love to visit again, maybe on the way to Red Rock.  I'll just have to remember that they're only open Mon-Fri.

At least now I can say I've been to a TRUE French cafe, outside of Paris...casino included!

"One time, Caesar went to Baguette Cafe. As he ate, he said, 'veni'."

Food is fantastic. Kreygasm. Coffee, croissants, quiche, and bread on point. I got Blue Brie, Chipotle, and Morrocan and I have ascended in bread consumption.

The servers are always happy (not the creepy kind you see at most food places and pretty much the opposite of what people you see playing at the slots at casinos RiPepperonis). The place is outside the Vegas strip mall, which is for the better because it would be run down by trashy tourists. BibleThump.

Would dank meme with 5/7 but it's 10/10 bruh.

This place is the bees knees.  The wasps ankles.  The elephants cankles.  The gorillas chinchillas. 

I wish it was located closer to me, but if it was, I would likely become obese from stuffing my face with their wonderful food.

This place is a hidden Gem.  Everything is really fresh and has a good taste.  So many cafes are just blaze (pronounced blah-zay) not sure how to spell it, lol.  I always enjoy the food there and being greeted by Olivier.  Definitely worth the trip, if you can find it...
Cream of carrot Good, espresso Good, Curry Chicken sandwich Amazing!!!! Cookies are fresh and delicious... Now I'm stuffed :)

This place is the Epcot Center of breakfast. You can take your tastebuds on a culinary journey through any land you can imagine, as long as it's France. They make their baguettes, croissants and quiche right before your very eyes. They cut the quiche in slices the size of NY pizza. 

The people behind the counter are very nice, and the service is quick. 

I love this place and recommend to anyone!

Olivier is one of the kindest restauranteurs I have met.  He loves what he does.  It shows in his food and the staff.  

I have eaten randomly at the Baguette Cafe  over the last 4 years.  It is always consistent and consistently surpasses my expectations.  

Today was the Chicken Curry Sandwich,  followed by a Pear Tart.  Both were OUTSTANDING.  It is worth seeking out!
Real frendly and relaxed atmosphere. Great little shop off the beaten path.lots of fresh healthy choices with some awsem sweets if your in the mood.

Guys!  This place has the best croissants!  Hands down!  We got there Sunday morning before a jaunt to ikea.  It was pretty crowded and could probably use either more staff or less seating inside to accommodate the masses, but it was worth the wait.  If the line wasn't taking so long to get through I would have ordered 5 more croissants to take home.  Everything was fresh made, mocha was great, and staff was friendly.

I've had this bookmarked for a while and realized it was closed weekends. Now that our days off are weekdays and our friends who have the same day off as us live in the SW, it was time to finally check something off my list that has been sitting there, patiently, for years. 

We were gonna order off the menu until we were told the two specialty sandwiches. There was a yellow curry chicken sandwich and a moroccan sandwich that had north african spices, goat cheese, red bellpepper, etc. Both sandwiches were great sounding so we chose those. I liked the moroccan a bit more, but only because Im a sucker for those flavors combos. The bread was nice, good balance of crusty and softer bready center. 

Got the ice tea of the day - green tea citrus gingko which was refreshing. I like places the brew fresh, and brew something a bit more unique that plain black. 

The service was really friendly - it was the owner of the place at the counter. He was super enthusiastic and caring of his place. They brought out our food outside and came to check on everyone outside which I didn't expect. It is always a nice touch for counter service places to still have some sort of service. 

I think the price to quality ratio was very good. It seems they use better products with an emphasis on natural, healthy choices and nice to have places not charge a arm to get fresh choices.

I can see why people like this as their casual lunch spot. I think there are other similar sandwich and coffee type cafes like these you can compare it to, and this I think this probably ranks top notch among them. I will be back to try more and try a specialty drink next time now that it's near places we frequent.

The moment I took a bite into my sandwich, I was instantly reminded of the baguettes I bought off the street in Paris.   So good!

Baguette CafÃ© is sort of in a weird spot in the middle of a bunch of an office park.  If you take Sunset, you have to weave through a bunch of office buildings.. or you can access it off Raphael Riviera (Frontage Rd.)  It's a great spot for a quick and delicious lunch.  Sandwiches/Panini's are about 7 bucks a pop.  Portions aren't exactly huge, but it's definitely quality.  The cafÃ© isn't large, but there is plenty of seating outside.  I came with a group of 4 and the workers and they scrambled to put tables together for us.  It was my first time there and the guy at the registered was warm and provided a bunch of information on each of the sandwiches.   Good service - much appreciated!

I got the Prosciutto baguette.  Good!  Fresh meat, great fixings such as bleu cheese and this walnut dressing.  All the flavors mixed beautifully!  The cajun chicken and tuna sandwich also got rave reviews from the people I was with.

Totally recommended if you have a chance to go there during your lunch hour.  I can't wait to go back and try more.  Don't forget though - it's closed on weekends :( !

We made the trek over here for lunch today from my workplace on the strip and it was DELICIOUS!!! My only complaint is that it's not open on the weekends! 

When we walked in, the owner was the one taking the orders. He asked if we had been there before, and when we said no, he explained the whole menu to us. He was SO personable! After we had gotten our food, he checked on our table outside to see how everything was. His service was outstanding, and I wish every place I went to had this great of service. It also helps that is french accent is to DIE for ;)

Ok, so onto the meal. I had the chicken pesto sandwich special. It was FULL of flavor. Sundried tomato pesto really made the whole sandwich pop. The bread was fresh, soft and chewy. It matched the sandwich perfectly. The chicken was delicious as well. It was perfectly cooked, and not dry. I seriously can't even say how awesome this place is! 

My table also split the chocolate tart. Can you say HEAVEN? Cause that's where I was when I was devouring it. It's rich and creamy. The slice was HUGE, and enough for 4 people to share.  I kinda want to go back just for that! 

If you haven't been here, you need to come STAT. Like I said, I wish it was open on the weekends cause I would be here every Saturday for lunch!
It's the first time I've come to this place, and the truth is that the taste is delicious and the coffee is the best. I will return more often to this place and the price is not expensive.

Let me start by saying that Oliver (the man at the cash register) is the sweetest, most welcoming man that ever helped me in any restaurant/cafe! I love this cute, small cafe! The food prices used to be cheaper but I could imagine how hard it would be to keep those prices. They used to have a you pick two (1/2 sandwich, 1/2 soup, 1/2 salad) for $5-$6 but it raised a dollar which is still pretty okay. He took the time to explain the items that aren't on the menu. I ordered the Moroccan which was grilled chicken, roasted tomatoes and roasted peppers, goat cheese, some kind of aioli mixed with North American spices. It was great! I also ordered a 1/2 turkey sandwich and a cup of onion soup. I really wanted to try the lemon tart and the seasonal fruit tart but I was just too full for that. The fact that mostly all their food items are organic and they can make it gluten free is awesome! Their meats aren't processed. They baked everything the morning of. Everything is fresh. What more can you ask for. Vegas needs to have small cafes like this in every corner!

Ever feel like you step out of your ordinary boring Vegas life and straight into the street of Paris? Well, thats what you feel when you step into this place. So many hustle bustle and a owner/barrista in Olivier that probably come straight out from Paris cook book.

Nice, friendly and absolutely Frenchy. Deliver great service with a smile, food are phenomenal although I prefer my baguette to be just a little bit softer cos it seems that I gotta chew with my jaw a little it. 

Great Illy coffee with big mug of coffee. My fiancee absolutely love it. What more can I say except.

Baguette Cafe J'etaime!

Their baguettes are perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside.  There is not too much flakiness from the baguette either, so eating a sandwich does not get too messy.  

The only downside to this place is the hours of operation, only opened M-F during work hours, 7am- 5pm. 

I just had the Bleu Brie sandwich today and it was delicious.  It was not my favorite though, since it was missing some kick to it.  Now what it specifically needs, I do not know.  I do love me some brie on baguette, though, yumm!  I really love the yellow curry chicken sandwich.  It's usually on the written menu.  If it is not, you can probably ask Olivier (I think that's his name, and I'm sorry if you're reading this - I forgot your name, but judging from what everyone else is writing, it looks like Olivier is your name) to make it for you.  I also like eating my sandwich in the cafe, since it comes with a palm-sized amount of salad.  It really is not a lot, but it's a very petite addition at no extra cost to your order. 

I also had the quiche today, the one with bacon and swiss cheese.  I've been wanting to try it in the past, but they'd always be out.  I ate the quiche after the sandwich, and being somewhat full did not stop me from enjoying the savoriness of this quiche.  

In the past, I had ordered a blended iced-coffee.  It wasn't as tasty as I like my iced coffee to be.  I usually like it on the stronger, chicory-esque, sweet side.  However, my coworker had one today, and she said it was good.   

The cafe gets a bit busy during lunch time.  I have yet to see how the foot-traffic is during the mornings.  If you have a 30 minute lunch, then I would suggest calling ahead of time and placing an order, just to prevent from waiting in a line to order and then waiting for your food to be made.  The cafe is pretty decently sized, a bit on the smaller size, but it works.

I'm definitely a fan of the food I've tried so far. The breakfast croissant with egg and ham was flaky and buttery, simply scrumptious. The chipotle chicken sandwich melts in your mouth with just the right amount of kick. And the chocolate tart? silky and luscious! The coffee on the other hand I could have gone without, I got a white chocolate mocha and cafÃ© mocha with hazelnut, neither drink made an impression. It needed more oomph in my opinion. There's also a bit of a wait for your food after you've ordered because there's only 2 of them, it took about 25 minutes for me to get out of there (there was a group of 3 ahead of me) They take pride in the quality of their food and it's really worth it in the end but I wouldn't go back unless I know I have plenty of time to spare. I wish they were open on the weekends though, it's a nice spot to have brunch with the family. I will surely be back one of these days.

The Baguette Cafe is one of the best-kept secrets in town!!!

It's secretly hidden from your view unless you venture to the back of the office park on West Sunset Road, northwest of the 215 and Buffalo Drive.

The baguettes, on which the sandwiches are served on is baked in-house. They are very light, crusty and buttery. My favorite sandwich is the "Prosciutto" which consists of mixed greens, prosciutto, tomatoes, and blue cheese spread.
I have had fantastic Quiche in many different French Cafes in Las Vegas, but Baguette Cafe surpasses them of all. It's fluffy, creamy, and very satisfying, the secret is in the flour and  temperature control. 
Don't leave without trying the torte, the chocolate and the mixed fruit taste heavenly.

Olivier is an amazing host, very nice and humble!!
On occasion, I'll mildly observe peoples interactions with him and he's always puts smiles on peoples faces. He genuinely cares about his customers, and the regulars feel that positive vibe thus express the appreciation. 
The prices are very reasonable, you won't be disappointed.

This cafe is definitely worth checking out!!!

I always see this place just off the 215 freeway. Today my sister and I decided to finally give it a try. They mostly serve breakfast and lunch with some yummy pastries in the display. I got the grilled eggplant sand which and my sister the veggie quiche. Both were delicious and were accompanied by a light salad with their house made balsamic vinaigrette. Inside was open with tables and a couch, however with it being beautiful outside and the patio seating had the perfect amount of shade we decided to enjoy our lunch outside. It was perfect and to top of our experience we split their tarimasu  cup. It was delicious, fluffy, soft, creamy, rich and just great! 

The employees were friendly, the food was amazing, the environment was great! We will be back!
The best French breakfast in town ! The sandwiches are so good and the pastries are delicious.
The best hot sandwich so far in my life! The owner was super nice. It was very filling.  I highly recommend this place!

Absolutely amazing French experience.  Food is fantastic; the quiche is the best my friends and I have ever tasted, and the pastries are very tasty as well.  The service is also  outstanding; the servers are very energetic and friendly.  Overall, an essential visit when in Vegas.
This place is still as great as I remember from back in 2012. Oliver is still as amicable and gracious as ever. And thankfully they still sale the best ginger ale ever!

DELICIOUS food with French influence. CHILL vibes. Great outdoor area. 

RECOMMENDATIONS:

1. The Chicken Sandwich
2. The Grilled Chipotle Sandwich with Chicken & Bacon
3. Quiche

Always fresh, always excellent.  The quiches and the curry sandwich are the best dishes, in my opinion, but everything is absolutely delicious.

I eat here approximately once per week, and am never disappointed.
Delicious as always! Thank you, Olivier and Baguette Cafe, for preparing, yet again, another quality and satisfying lunch! Love, love, love!

This spot has a great ambience, spectacular French food and really warm, genuine customer service. I came here for my first visit recently, and can't wait to come back. I'm so lucky to live nearby. I had the Blue Brie, and a plum tart, and was blown away by the taste. They really don't cut corners on the quality of the ingredients in every dish, from the entrees to the pastries, and even the beverages. It's not overly rich, everything is as fresh as possible, the prices are reasonable, and the food is so good it could be served at an expensive restaurant but the atmosphere is welcoming and unpretentious. Love it!

When you couple great service with wholesome, nourishing food, you seem to find yourself at the Baguette Cafe...at least, that was the case when I visited. I had always been meaning to try the Baguette Cafe for months, but finally made it up here after running random errands around the city. The hype, unlike most places, is well-deserved.

Right when I walked in, the place was full to capacity - tables occupied inside and out, a line forming all the way to the door. Luckily, this allowed me to sort out my indecisions, and decided upon a tea and the Eggplant panini. Not only are the other fellow patrons incredibly nice (as found out through enduring a line together), but Olivier is perhaps one of the sweetest, most charming men. Joking around, offering suggestions, and making small talk even when there are five people behind me, he makes you feel right at home, and treats you as a patron rather than another order. 

Sitting outside, I was brought my tea by Oliver and panini accompanied by a small salad later on by another staff member. The panini was so simple, yet so immensely satisfying. Eggplant, mozzarella, and marinara sauce on bread - even though I could count the ingredients on one hand, it tasted phenomenal. You could taste the love that went into such a simple sandwich The salad was a nice sidekick, playing the role of added nutrition to all the carbs I was about to ingest. 

After my meal, Olivier really showed his gregariousness. Wrapping up my leftovers, he asked how the meal went and other various questions. But what impressed me the most was adding in another packet of the green tea I had ordered as well as being so friendly and relaxed despite being in the midst of a rush. 

Honestly, Baguette Cafe is the sort of place I could sit at for hours, staring at the nearby mountain range - throw in some more delicious food and a cup of tea, and I'd be perfectly content. The savory side of the menu was impressive, and only leaves me with an excuse to visit again to try all of the sweeter goods.

Baguette Cafe is always amazing. The owner is so sweet and remembers his guests. I like the family feel in this cafe, as he often mentions his wife, mom, and brother. Everything on the menu is gold: fresh-pressed juices, soups, pastries, but my favorite is the Acai Bowl, YUM. I've been many times, and will be back many more!

Go in early! I came in around 2:30 last Saturday afternoon and the cafÃ© was sold out of mostly everything! I got lucky that they had ONE piece of their delicious baguette left for me. Too bad my fiancÃ© and brother could not have any, hehee. I got the tuna sandwich and the combination of the crispy bread, cold egg, and salty tuna was JUST RIGHT. Best tuna sandwich ever. 

The wait is a little long so plan on coming when you have time to spare, but promise you it is so worth it!

First let me say, I got lost looking for this place.  It was so hard to find it but once you get the hang of the location, there's no getting lost anymore.  The question had reached my ears, "Sarah, where are we eating today?"

For a while now, I've been wanting to try this place out because of the reviews from yelp, as always.  Plus, it's different to Asian and Mexican food that we've been eating in the past.  My boss decided to drive with me, and thank God she did because if it weren't for her I would've been making u-turns on a constant basis.  

We got there and immediately I thought of California.  My boss thought the same since there are tables and chairs outside and the patrons who went there had the appearance of being from Cali.  I can't explain any further than this.  Lax?  Laid back?

Anyway, I ordered the chipotle chicken panini and turnip soup that had brochuto (wrong spelling) in it.  Mmmm... delish! As how my boss describes it after eating hers.  The spice in chipotle was just enough to give the panini that extra umph.  The soup was definitely delicious and I'm almost addicted to it.  I tried my boss's bell pepper and tomato soup and it was just okay.  I think the turnip soup beat that hands down.  Even she said so herself.

Overall experience was awesome.  I'd come back over and over again just to try everything else in their menu board.  Which by the way, they don't have a menu.  I think they change their menu regularly.  I actually like that.

This has got to be the best quaint breakfast place I've been to.  I had a quiche and mocha and by far the best I've ever had.  I will be back many times over.  Remember they don't open until 9am on the weekends so if you're an early riser you might be disappointed.  Get there right at 9am to get a table as there is limited seating.

Great food excellent experience of a french cuisine! Coffee is strong customer service is one if a kind Outside is a very nice terrace so you can enjoy Vegas's beautiful weather! I love setting up my business meetings there! No regrets! Visit Baguette caffe! Best regards:Shoeaddic,Las Vegas
This is a nice quiet place, great ambiounce, and great place to just unwine with a great food and lattes. Also out you are looking for authenticity this is the place to go.
BEST cafe in Vegas! I love coming to eat here, and do so as often as possible!! Thank you Olivier and staff for some of the best food around!

Went here on a recommendation and was in this part of town. 2pm. Not terribly busy but a little. Behind the counter was a mess - everything was seemingly unorganized, pastries on trays and not very neat. Took a couple minutes to get my order in, i tried the chicken pesto. It had sundried tomatoes and a walnut pesto which didnt have much flavor - also the chicken was very bland. Overall very boring and plain sandwich with a very sad side salad. Not quite sure how this place has such good reviews - Im sure the pastries/smoothies and other items must be delicious.

A hidden gem-
My daughter and I were looking for a quick bite after a trip to the hardware store and yelp brought up this place. The only downside is FINDING the place. I hope they get plenty of business from the office complex there.
Anyways, she had a fruit cup and croissant, I had a bacon quiche. YUMMO! We were both very happy!
The staff is really nice and very helpful. I will be back if I am over there and remember it exists!

Soup, sandwiches, quiche and ginger! I went in again this week for a quick lunch, and I was still pleased as pudding. Oliver was there, charming as ever. I ordered a quiche and a cup of soup, and both were delicious. However, even though the food is the perfect lunch, I am equally enthralled by the ginger beverages! They take special care to carry natural beverages (no high fructose), and this time they had straight up ginger ale with chunks of ginger. That alone is enough to earn repeat visits from me!

Pass thru every time I'm in Vegas. It's where the French expats go for a croissant or a sandwich. As other reviewers stated, it's in a business trip mall, away from the bustle of the strip. They serve Illy coffee which is a plus, service is great, and I like the vibe there. It's not trying to be "cute, French or hip."  Having spent a total of 4 months in France and eating way more than my share of pastries and sandwiches, I can assuredly say, it's a detour and stop worth making if you're anywhere in the Vegas area.

What I've ordered:
Chocolate twist
Chocolate Croissant
Tuna Sandwich
Orange Blossom cheesecake
Chocolate tart
Butter croissant
Various drinks

Hidden Gem in LV
Best Croissants in LV
Owners & Staff friendly
Guaranteed you will go back for more!

Best Part is it's only 5 mins from home for us

Our food was great. We went for a late lunch and they weren't really busy. The owner and his staff really make you feel at home. 
My shrimp bisque and simple ham sandwich on a super delicious baguette were the perfect amount of food. My sister loved her salad. The pear tart was delicious. 
If they had been open on the weekend, we would have probably returned. 
It was a little difficult to navigate through the maze of parking at the office complex where it's located, but it's sooooo worth it.

Definitely will be back soon! 
Had the grilled Chipotle Chicken sandwich, I could've eaten two more it was so delicious. I'll also be buying more of the cookie butter dark chocolate! Excellent service, flavorful food, and clean cafÃ©.
Amazing food, especially for the price.  The only downside was that the waiter was obviously weeded and I waited an eternity before getting my own coffee.

If my office was closer I'd eat here nearly everyday (as it is I make the trek 1-2x a week!). Olivier is a fabulous host and seems genuine and passionate about the quality of his food. Yup, it's just a sandwich shop, but I cannot think of a better soup/salad/sandwich spot in town. His food reminds me of eating in a cute cafe in Paris without the price tag! 

I typically get the Proscuitto salad and one of his yummy soups. They change daily and have yet to disappoint. The cream of mushroom was the best cream of mushroom I've ever had. I look forward to trying more of them every time I go. 

My favorite new addition to the menu is the FRESH Thai coconuts !! I adore coconut water so getting the chance to drink out of a fresh coconut from Thailand on my lunch break is a major treat.

I won't deduct any stars for this, but it's a major bummer there is never any quiche when I go at lunch. Apparently it sells out at breakfast. I keep crossing my fingers and hoping he'll have some at lunch time someday!!  The selection of baked type things is relatively limited in general, but I appreciate that they make the baked good fresh so it's hard to have a huge variety on hand at a small restaurant. 

I adore Baguette Cafe because there is decidedly nothing Vegas about it. Fresh healthy DELICIOUS foods served by a charming owner - I've found my favorite lunch spot in Vegas.

This place still rocks!! I had not been able to stop by for a year+, but everything is the same or better. They have great outdoor seating, improved furniture since my last visit. It's comfy and inviting. Service is streamlined and improved compared to a couple of years ago. The wait times are more like 10 minutes assuming you do not arrive at peak lunch (when the wait times may be longer, I think). Food quality and taste are still the absolute bomb! I ordered my favorite sandwich the spicy curry during both my recent visits. But ordered once with eggplant and then the next time with chicken. Even tho, I am no longer a vegetarian, the eggplant version is my still my favorite. It is just so tasty. I also can vouch for the strawberry smoothie, the chocolate tart and the chickpea soup. All delicious! And fresh -- some restaurants when they are successful quality and service decrease -- this place has only gotten better.

Everyone listen up this cafe is got to be the best kept secret in the southwest of our wonderful city, I'm rarely impressed or so satisfied by the quality of food and service that I ask of anyone to come and enjoy this cafe. I will tell you that this kind of place is rare and I'm glad it is so close to my home, I will definitely be coming back for more again and again. 

Make sure to try their soups and their excellent sandwiches, I know I know it is just a Cafe but believe me when I tell you that for food that is made so well and with so much care it deserves to be praised and talked about. Oliver gave us such good service and attention that I'm willing to share with everyone the beauty that it is the Baguette Cafe. 

Enjoy......

This place is awesome. I always get the chicken Moroccan sandwich...it never disappoints! And a bowl of whatever the soup of the day is...always different. I highly recommend Baguette Cafe for a nice light yet filling lunch.

Thanks to google map I found this place after circling around the whole block twice. At the register, Olivier rattled off a bunch of ingredients after I asked him what specialty drinks he can make. I picked the chocolate frosted almond as the main ingredient for my latte and asked him to make me a drink that's not too bitter and not too sweet. He then made the drink and asked me to taste it to see if it's to my liking. It was just perrrrrrfect! Olivier you rock!

I also ordered a vegetable quiche that smelled like rosemary and filled with cherry tomatoes, zucchini, spinach and egg. Delish! I'm totally coming back here when I'm in the Rhodes Ranch area.

Items Selected:
Chocolate Torte
Croissant
Chocolate Twist
Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Cookie
Banana Nut Chocolate Chip Muffin
Financier

Highly praised by locals and viewed from the highway on my Monday to Wednesday commute the lone factor preventing me from visiting Olivier Brouillet's "Baguette CafÃ©" to date was the weekday only hours, an understandable choice given the restaurant's business-park locale but a pity for those living within the somewhat Un-Vegasy constraints of a 7:30a-5:00p Monday through Friday schedule.  Small in size but airy in dÃ©cor it was just after eight o'clock on a PTO Monday with family in town that our trio made way into the brightly lit room and with a few locals lingering over coffee as fresh baked goods stocked a small pastry case it was mere seconds before Olivier greeted us with a smile, our affirmation to his "first time?" inquiry leading to a full description of nearly every item ready or soon to emerge from the kitchen and our eventual order comprising the majority of them.
